reviews.text: Was so excited to have Cheesecake Factory tonight but our hopes were quickly dashed. We got the wrong order. And it wasn&#39;t very good. And no bread. Luckily, our slice of cheesecake was included- that was my dinner tonight. <br><br>Restaurants need to remember we&#39;re tired of this take out issue too.

Really subpar. Sticky table, cold bread, ordered a New York strip cooked medium, was served a well done steak. Next steak they brought out was cooked a little closer to medium but unfortunately had the flavor profile of tap water and was at least 25% fat. Like they don&#39;t even try. A $25 steak should at least taste like half that price. Reminded me of a steak I got at Waffle House a few years back.

Dined at the bar on a Sunday. It worked well as I was dining alone, was only ordering cheesecake, and required no wait as opposed to the main dining area which was quite busy that afternoon. My usual go-to is the Oreo cheesecake, but I thought I would try something new this time and get the Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple. <br><br>It unfortunately didn&#39;t quite meet my hopes. I did appreciate that it was a smaller cheesecake slice, leaving me feeling less overstuffed afterwords. However, I was hoping for a bit more flavor. The butterfinger and Reese&#39;s cup pieces seemed to be overwhelmed just by the cheesecake. Maybe could have been enhanced by a peanut butter drizzle or giant candy piece. They did fulfill my request for double whipped cream though! Overall I&#39;d give it a 6/10, but I would certainly recommend sitting at the bar and taking advantage of the free vread as always.

I&#39;ve been going to The Cheesecake Factory for years and have enjoyed their food and atmosphere most of the time. This location isn&#39;t as impressive as ones I&#39;ve visited in other states, but it&#39;s nice enough to where I&#39;ve returned a few times - mainly to satisfy my sudden cravings for their cheesecake.<br><br>This was a cheesecake visit only. I sat at the bar to order their seasonal cheesecake Peppermint Bark. Rather, I ordered the Coffee &amp; Cream Chocolate Supreme, as I was motioned by someone that the Peppermint Bark wasn&#39;t good. Also, I asked the bartender about this cheesecake and his answer was all over the place. Therefore, I concluded it hasn&#39;t consistently received good feedback. Their cheesecake isn&#39;t cheap and I like to be pretty certain. Well....I ended up not liking the Coffee &amp; Cream cheesecake. I ate it all, as it wasn&#39;t horrible, but I won&#39;t order again. I have a few winning favorites, but my all time go-to is the White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut (so delicious!). You can always rely on their cheesecake presentation being on point. I sometimes hate sticking in the fork the first time, but once I do and take that first bite it&#39;s all over.<br><br>Just a few extra notes I&#39;ve noticed to be repeats - parking usually requires much  patience unless you valet and the service (bar and dining) are pretty decent.

The last time I had been to the Cheesecake Factory was high school. Wow! It&#39;s been a really long time.<br><br>I came for lunch at 11:30 and the parking lot was just fine and dandy. No trouble finding a spot. But as I was leaving close to 2, there were so many cars circling around for a spot.<br><br>We had no wait when we got in, but as we left, so many people were waiting for a table! And it&#39;s a Wednesday! I guess people were still off work for the holidays.<br><br>I saw lots of high school students here, girls with their moms, and families. <br><br>My friend and I both got sweet teas. Yum! It had a nice freshness to it. Not quite like Cunningham&#39;s, but still pretty good.<br><br>They give complimentary bread with butter. Reminded me of the fresh kind they give at Irish Rover. Still very good!<br><br>I got me a burger off the skinny menu. The skinny menu has a select few items that are basically healthier versions of stuff on the regular menu but smaller portions. <br><br>I asked for it medium well and it had mayo, lettuce, and tomato. No onion. And ketchup on the side. It comes with a side salad but I replaced it with steamed broccoli. So good!!<br><br>My friend got a salad with grilled chicken and balsamic dressing.<br><br>Their menu is huge! I wasn&#39;t sure what I was going to order. There aren&#39;t really items below $10, so be ready to spend a little. It&#39;s still worth it though! We both liked our food!<br><br>Again, it&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been back. I&#39;ve had their cheesecakes before which are huge and delicious and I&#39;ve also had some sort of chicken Parmesan with angel hair pasta a long time ago. It was filling and I remember being unable to finish.<br><br>These days, I can&#39;t do dairy. <br><br>My friend got a chocolate mousse cheesecake she couldn&#39;t finish and took home and I ordered the mango key lime cheesecake to take home for my mom.<br><br>Service was fantastic! The waitress made to sure to keep my glass filled with tea and knew the menu very very well. She had a great attitude and some good recommendations. <br><br>Can&#39;t wait to go back! I was shocked that I ended up enjoying the food! So glad I came!

My friend and I brought our friend here for the first time and his birthday a couple weeks ago, I got the BBQ ranch salad, my friend had a grilled chicken sandwich and the other the general Tso chicken. Everything was delicious, the service was a bit slow we were there almost two hours and we didn&#39;t have a appetizer or drinks. <br><br>The menu is large and overwhelming but there is a wide variety and I have had anything bad here when I have come.

I&#39;ve always loved the Cheesecake Factory when O was amid, and that hasn&#39;t changed! Service is always great despite the crowd level. The cocktails are always delicious too! I especially love the sangria! I also really appreciate that they have a Skinnilicious menu as I try to watch what I eat. The items on that menu are healthy and delicious especially the turkey burger and enchiladas! Finally, the cheesecake is always impeccable regardless of what flavor I get. For a chain, the Cheesecake Factory does a great job!

I  love Cheesecake Factory. Amazing bread to start with. Pasta is so good. I always get the red velvet cheesecake (layers of  red velvet and layers of plain cheesecake).  It  is always super crowded because it is located in the mall. I also think it is a touch pricey.

Love the grandiose atmosphere despite this being a chain restaurant: vaulted ceilings, stained glass light fixtures and vases, large pillars reminiscent of Roman architecture. Interior is beautiful and simplistic. <br><br>The menu boasts a large variety of dishes - pizza, pastas, chicken dishes, Asian-inspired entrees, sandwiches, burgers, etc. Everyone will find something they enjoy here. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to CF dozens of times and always look forward to the Firecracker Salmon Rolls, but was sadly informed today that they were taken off the menu (insert sad, confused, and crying emojis). <br><br>Despite that letdown, we ordered the pasta carbonara with chicken and the Louisiana Chicken pasta (it was a carb-rich day), along with a complimentary basket of bread. The breads were fresh, the butter was the perfect temperature for spreading, and both pastas were rich, creamy, and perfect. The Louisiana carried just enough spice, delicious! The pastas were both lunch portions and were $14 and $17, which was slightly high for a lunch, but they were tasty.<br><br>No cheesecake was ordered today, but I love every variety on the menu; the Snickers is a top one for me as well as the Tuxedo (yummm). All cheesecakes run between $6-$8 and are gigantic portions (enough to share). <br><br>Overall this is a place I enjoy and will continue to return, but the price points make it an &#34;occasional&#34; spot that we stop into.

Don&#39;t come here if you&#39;re looking for an inexpensive date night. Now that the disclaimer is out of the way, I must say, I&#39;ve never had a bad experience or meal here. The food is always good, the menu is so big it&#39;s almost scary, the decor is amazing and the desserts are beyond fabulous. We enjoyed cocktails, entrees and desserts with friends and had a very nice time.
They have different menu items and the staff is always very helpful. Dessert is always delicious no matter what you choose.

Had last minute free up of the kids so this became our date night. Decided to come here and have dinner.<br><br>We arrived and were placed in a waiting queue. We didn&#39;t have too long of a wait.<br><br>We started off with the Buffalo Chicken Blasts as an appetizer. They were delicious! We loved them. <br><br>For dinner I ordered the Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger with the fries, I had an Arnold Palmer for my beverage. It had sugar around the brim of the glass which was pretty cool.<br><br>The food was pretty good, our waitress was awesome, she kept our drinks filled. Our food was hot when it came out, I almost got the cheesecake, but man I&#39;d have been stufffffed! <br><br>Great date night dinner, now off to see John Wick 3!

Yes I know it&#39;s a chain- but it&#39;s amazing. They do a great job with food and service! I&#39;ve never been disappointed. The portions are large enough to share. We love to do an app and entree or entree and cheesecake! Chicken and biscuits and chicken Madeira are my faves. The egg rolls, Mac and cheese, and crab dip are awesome apps!

So far... we waited 5 minutes at the bar to be greeted by the bartender who was talking to the servers in the well. We ordered drinks and food at the same time. 7 more minutes... no bread. There are zero other people at the bar; however, there are still 3 dirty plates on the bar and no bartender to be found. No wait. <br>We&#39;ve had good experiences but so far no good.

This was the 2nd time I have been here and thought the ambience was nice and intimate. it was an impromptu date with my husband. We had drinks and appetizer. Our waitress (Brenda I think) I ordered medium steak and it came out perfect. I thought it was a great steak and we had desert of a  delicious key lime cheesecake! We literally ate til we were painfully full. It was totally worth it! <br>The whole experience was lovely and we will be back!
The Cheesecake Factory, at St. Matthews, is clearly following safety standards and the service and food were both terrific.

Girls Day............who doesn&#39;t love having lunch with their mom and a divine dessert afterwards? <br><br>We just had to cross the bridge for the Cheesecake Factory. Mom got the Rene special and I got the Louisiana pasta from the lunch menu. Both meals were more than we could eat. Our waiter recommended my meal to me and I have to say I&#39;d definitely recommend it to anyone who likes pasta with a touch of spice. <br><br>Mom had soup with her meal and the carrots were like boulders. She had to cut them in tiny pieces just to fit them into her spoon. <br><br>We both drink our tea unsweetened, so we thought we&#39;d try the tropical, bad idea. I usually love a little mango or peach flavor added to my tea. This was an odd flavor that neither of us cared for. <br><br>We did save room for cheesecake, with the recommendation of our waiter we chose the dulce de leche carmel . It was a grand choice. We absolutely loved it. I could go back for just that and a glass of wine!
I had them add sun-dried tomatoes to dish and it was amazing!!! By far the best pasta I have ever had at the cheese cake factory.

It&#39;s hard not to like this place, especially if you are a big fan of cheesecake. I grew up going to the original location in downtown Chicago, where the servings were super plentiful. That isn&#39;t the case now. While the cheesecake slices can be big enough to share, the meal portions are average. I really like the chicken tenders and fries. They are always so crisp and crunchy with the right amount of meat. They give you breads as an appetizer but the bread is the harder crust type that doesn&#39;t appeal to me. As far as the desserts, the caramel turtle cheesecake is my absolute favorite. On this visit I tried the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut. Wow is all I can say. The caramel is cooked into the macadamia in the bottom crust of the cheesecake and it is phenomenal. I haven&#39;t eaten a whole slice of cheesecake in one setting ever but I literally did not want my tastes of this gem to end.

The menu here is an absurdity. To expect someone to be able to do good versions of all these dishes strains credibility. And everything is a little more expensive than it should be. But I&#39;ve got to say, the cheesecakes are fantastic. And I&#39;ve had some good meals here. And it&#39;s a nice place. So go for it. But if you&#39;re not in the mood for dessert, look elsewhere.

If your looking for Cheese Cake then look no further! This is your place.   They have a wonderful selection of cheese cake. Your belly will enjoy it! That is if your into cheese cake! If your not. Then there may be something wrong with your mouth. Jk jk okay maybe there is. <br><br>  The menus has a good selection of food. I myself fancy myself as a steak person and very picky. The steak Dian was my choice. It&#39;s delicious. As it has four slices of steak and a good helping of mash. The sauce they put on it is Devine and will make your mouth water. It has mushrooms in it with some type of greenery to top it off. Which brings the plate together. You don&#39;t believe me? Stop in and try it for yourself you won&#39;t be disappointed. <br><br>  The food may have been on point but the service was sub par. For such a nice restaurant I expected more out of service. It is connected to a mall. So that should had set my thoughts on standards and service.   I think our server may have had too many tables.   Also a server tray on top of plates that a visiting patron will be eating bread and appetizer on is not okay. It&#39;s not sanitary.  Pretty sure those suckers get thrown around a lot.  At least from what I have seen in other restaurants.

My wife and I decided to have lunch midweek at this location on Shelbyville Rd; our 1st time. We arrived at 11:00 am and wasn&#39;t very busy with only few customers. The interior is beautiful. We were seated and our server was attentive and we had our drinks quickly. With such an extensive menu, we needed a few monuments to review but what looked good as an appetizer was the Calamari. <br>The Calamari Was served promptly; lightly fried and very good. (wish maybe a sweet chili type sauce rather than cocktail sauce). We were half way through when felt rushed to order our lunch by sever. Regardless, I ordered the Shepherds which is delicious described pie(dinner portion) while my wife the the Caesar salad, Flat bread mushroom pizza with Truffle Oil. <br>The &#34;Shepherd&#39;s pie&#34; I ordered was a huge disappointment; the potato and cheese topping was tasteless and inconsistent warm. The ground beef didn&#39;t taste fresh at all and you could see it sitting in a bowl of liquid fat; the large amount of oily fat can be seen around my dish and throughout. Didn&#39;t appear much vegetables with few peas and the carrots; carrots were semi hard not throughly cooked. <br>I took leftover home and its obvious you can see there was still substantial amount of fat that solidified. <br>My wife&#39;s salad was drenched in Caesar dressing and she didn&#39;t like it so I ate it since it was better than my dish. The mushroom flatbread was the highlight of our meal as we both thought it was very good. Look at the pictures and you be the judge

I love Cheesecake Factory although their gigantic menu sometimes overwhelms me. I usually stick with my favorites- meatloaf, grilled salmon and the burgers. The egg rolls are great starters! <br><br>The Chicken Riesling is a very tasty dish. It has chicken pieces sautéed with pieces of bacon in a wine sauce and is served with pasta. Another favorite is Sheila&#39;s Avocado Chicken Salad. Very light and flavorful. We love the bread too. <br><br>I can honestly say that I have never had a bad meal or bad service at the Cheesecake Factory in Louisville.

Most of us have been to a Cheesecake Factory so you know what the food is like, but the service at this one in particular is just not worth it. We ordered our food at 5:30...it&#39;s 7:15 and we still don&#39;t have it. Save the time and headache and go to another chain or better yet a local place.
Literally just waited out in the parking lot for over half an hour on cheese cake they completely forgot I ordered.

The restaurant was truly out of sorts. Disorganized, servers wearing cheap wigs and head rags like your find at a Halloween party. Some servers were in stained thread bare white shirts and wrinkled black pants. However most of the staff looked very professional. <br><br>The foyer was a crowded wet mess. No umbrella bags, no &#39;wet floor&#39; signs with standing room only  had the floors ready for a slip n fall. <br><br>The area had leftover holiday decorations with the cash register sitting on a banquet table covered with gift wrapped advertisement packages. The banquet tables had been shoved in front of the benches in the foyer causing the seating to be unavailable to the waiting guests. <br><br>Immediately upon being seated we noticed our silverware still had the last guests meal on it and the napkin were stained. <br><br>The restroom were HORRIBLE. No tissue in two of the 4 stalls, faucets leaking all over the counter tops, soap dispenser empty but the nastiest unhealthiest thing of all were the toilets. <br><br>The base of the toilets (wax seals) were leaking right onto the floors. Imagine if you&#39;d worn fabric shoes... just soaking up sewage like a sponge. Just disgusting! Any of the 4 hostesses that were giggling and hanging out behind the hostess stand, swapping holiday stories, could have been clearing the foyer or stocking the restrooms or at the very least.. taking notes for the managers to delegate the duties. <br><br>We had eaten BEFORE I visited the ladies room or we&#39;d have left RIGHT THEN. The food was good BUT our server was AMAZING! We were the party of 3, in the bar area with male in the wheelchair. I didn&#39;t get her name, she was petite, blond, fair skinned and INCREDIBLE!!<br><br>If your looking for a relaxing enjoyable experience choose another restaurant or at least a different location.

The last two times my wife and I have went, she has been disappointed with her meal. Her Parmesan crusted chicken was cold and the broccoli looked old and uncooked last night. I had the brick chicken and it was great as always but as the saying goes &#34;if momma ain&#39;t happy ain&#39;t no one happy&#34; so we won&#39;t be back for a while.

I always forget about Cheesecake Factory--- just cause its a chain restaurant and a little out of my way! But man, everytime I do go I am NEVER disappointed by the food! Its always so full of flavor and just so satisfying! My favorite is the Korean Fried Cauliflower-omg its so good! You would not even know its cauliflower had you not ordered it as that. If they had told me it was chicken in a blind fold taste test, Id believe them! So good! I love all their pastas that Ive tried. And I just recently tried the chicken taquitos, those were superb as well. Ive yet to choose a bad meal here!
We were seated at the time of our reservation, our food was all delicious. We will be back!

This is the second time I&#39;ve done DoorDash with Cheesecake Factory and this is the second time to be had issue with the order. Needless to say that I won&#39;t be ordering Cheese Cale Factory from doordash again!!!

Restaurant chains are always hit or miss. I had a great experience today, but tonight someone might have a different one. <br>But, I have to give credit where it&#39;s due. Had a late lunch here today and everything was exceptional. And, honestly, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal at any Cheesecake Factory. The service was great. Our waitress was not overly friendly, but she was timely and kept our drinks refilled and checked how our food was each time something new came out. I can&#39;t ask for more. All the food was great but let&#39;s be honest, I went for the cheesecake and will keep coming back for it!

It&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve visited The Cheesecake Factory. The menu is so large that it can be overwhelming. We had a mediocre experience overall. Our food was very average. The Oreo Cheesecake was the highlight. We ordered it to go and ate it at home.

Friday after work my friend needed a partner in crime to do a little pre-Christmas shopping. So I joined in. It&#39;s always better to take care of the holiday shopping before the psychotic holiday crowds start and stores jack their prices up in December. We decided to go to St. Mathews Mall to see if anything caught our eyes, but first needed to grab a bite for some after work energy. <br>      We decided to go to Cheesecake Factory, since it&#39;s located in the mall which made it convenient. I like this place because their menu is pretty large and gives you many options. Their were lots of empty tables, but the wait time to be seated was still 20 minutes. It was around 5:30 on a Friday night, and I&#39;m sure the staff was trying to prepare for the Friday crowd about to come in or maybe shift change. Ten minutes into our wait time, it did get extremely crowded. <br>         We decided to get some appetizers and specialities to share. We got samosas with cilantro sauce and a cauliflower dish for the appetizers. They were both good. You can&#39;t go wrong with samosas. They are triangle shaped eggrolls, but Indian/African inspired. The sauce on the cauliflower was addictive. We couldn&#39;t stop eating them. It&#39;s just like their brown starter bread. I could get full eating the bread with butter, before they bring the actual food out. <br>         We then got the cilantro mango dish and the orange chicken. They went really light on the orange sauce which is fine, but next time I will ask for extra orange sauce on the side. Talking about sauce, did you know they sell their sauces in jars for $8-$10? This is a pretty good price and their jars are good sizes. I&#39;ve made their tamarind sauce and their peanut sauce at home before, and the ingredients run you around the same price or more. So if you ever eat one of their dishes and enjoy the sauce in it, you can ask them to purchase a jar to go. Some of the jars are already made up to go, and they sell them at the dessert counter. <br>          The only con: I didn&#39;t even look at the menu and ordered my favorite dish, Firecracker salmon. The lady told me you no longer have that. WHAT HAPPENED TO MY FIRECRACKER SALMON DISH!? Why did you remove this from the menu? I used to purchase this as a salad because the yummy red cabbage bed the fried salmon sat on and the yummy dressing. Please bring it back.

I love The Cheesecake Factory, their portion sizes are nice considering their food prices are a bit higher than most places. Their staff is typically very friendly, they mostly keep a smile on their face. <br><br>I love the ambiance in the restaurant, you almost always have to dress up otherwise you&#39;ll feel like a sore thumb sticking out because the place feels upscale. <br><br>Their food is fantastic when they prep it properly, that&#39;s my biggest issue and grip. They do well most of the time, but sometimes they are inconsistent. I&#39;ve had some of the best shrimp scampi here (what I typically order) and I&#39;ve also had some of the worst. They typically do it well 90% of the time but that last 10% can be a drab sometimes. <br><br>It won&#39;t stop me from coming here though! I love visiting, to me it&#39;s almost like an event that I have to partake in. I&#39;ll be back fairly soon for some more shrimp scampi. Thank you guys for the good food!

Most of the food was decent. I ordered some wings and the waitress literally served them to me burnt. It was clearly not something you want to serve to a customer. The service was good and the waitress was attentive. Overall a decent experience.

I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo and a slice of Reese&#39;s cheesecake. I ended up feeling really nauseous after eating. Later that day, I kept throwing up, having diarrhea, and sweating profusely. I went to the immediate care center for them to tell me I had food poisoning. I refuse to ever feel that horrible again. I&#39;ve only eaten here a few times, but never again.

While doing some shopping we decided to pop in for drinks and lunch around 2 pm.   The line was out The door with what I assume was brunch guests.   We proceeded to the bar area and sat at a two top for 5-7 min without so much as a whisper of a server.   Moved to the actual bar.  The bar tender immediately took our drink and food order.    Chardonnay&amp;Bellini. Two small salads and the buffalo blasts.  Drinks and bread came immediately.  Food took another 30 min coming in 3 deliveries 5 min apart.   Salads were great.  Spicy Caesar small plate is huge.   Buffalo blasts were a bit greasy.  Everything was just a bit off from our normal experience.  <br><br>My wife would like me to mention the bathrooms were horrible.  likely due to crowd, but should always be checked.

Very good chain restaurant.  Menu variety. Good service. Very good food. I had the jambalaya Cajun pasta with chicken. Wife had 3 taco with seared tuna. I&#39;ll add the pics. Prices seem a little high but probably comparable to other restaurants of this kind. But the portions are huge. I will have lunch leftover today. Also the Oreo cheesecake is 5 star. We come here about every three months.  Satisfied every time. <br><br>Updating review. Ate here last night. One of our favorite chain restaurants. Food and service were very good. See pics. Only thing about chain restaurants is you get some loud people in sometime who think they are at home    Also wine per glass is as much as some of the fancy restaurants. Otherwise this place is always an option for us!

Atmosphere was great, wait was a bit long but it was friday so totally understandable, the food was ok but just not what I was expecting, the wine was not well paired to my meal as my server didn&#39;t seem to understand that&#39;s what i was asking for a recommendation for, the cheesecake I ordered was the white chocolate rasberry truffle and I wasnt a fan of the texture or the whipped cream topping it was very googey and jelly like throughout but my dinner date had an oreo dream cheesecake and it was amazing it was much more cheesecake consistency.  I think if you find the right combination of drink, entree, and dessert or a server that can help guide you this restaurant would be a five star easy.

Great food ... but over priced <br>Manufactured wait bc they can&#39;t run a staff schedule.. 20 min wait for one of the 12 empty tables in the restaurant <br>The female manager was by far one of the rudest self important pieces of shit I&#39;ve dealt with lately if I needed someone to mumble make excuses and faces at me &amp; while I walked away I would go to McDonald&#39;s

Love the Cheesecake Factory <br>Love the staff<br>Love the menu love the ambiance.<br>We eat here quite a bit and totally enjoy every visit we&#39;ve made.  The food is fantastic and the variety is outstanding.  I started this dinner with a fantastic Cucumber Martini..oh my goodness bring me another one.  Appetizers tonight were those favorite lettuce wraps, try them you&#39;ll fall in food love after the first bite.  For dinner I took a different approach and had the Chicken and Biscuits.  Someone should slap the person who designed this dish...I had to order another martini to wash it down!  We had ten in our group this time and our server Matt did not miss a thing!<br>From the greet he was sharp, informing us of the daily soup and informing us that there were some dishes they were out of.  Matt was great from start to finish.  Matt should be a trainer!<br>Of course we had cheesecake and I could rant about the place forever because I love eating here.  If you haven&#39;t tried CF then you are missing a great establishment.   Why wait any longer

I think the best advice I can give is be prepared for a wait a come extremely hungry!!! Maybe wait for a day or two to eat, because you won&#39;t be able to decide what you want and it&#39;s going to be delicious at this location. ( That not eating was a joke... it&#39;s seriously not healthy.) <br><br>I am so excited they have the Incredible Burger here now!!! It makes this one of my favorite places to go!! If you are a vegetarian there are not a ton of options on the menu, but since this latest update they really have added a few options. This being the best! <br><br>Prior to this addition....to be honest this place wasn&#39;t even on my list of places to dine. I hope they keep adding some vegetarian friendly options, since the dietary trends are continuously moving in that direction, for multiple reasons.

I try to eat local whenever possible. However, over the weekend my sister-in-law and her family were visiting and they had some dietary restrictions that made it difficult to choose a local place. So we came here based on the 20+page menu. I&#39;ve been here several times with my mom when we were shopping too. I can honestly say I&#39;ve never had a bad experience.<br><br>On our most recent visit we had a table for ten and a high chair. Some servers would have been frustrated with three kids and a baby in their section. Not ours! He was so friendly and great with the munchkins. He let the kids order while we waited for part of the party to arrive. My husband and I also ordered early because we weren&#39;t sure how long our 10 month old would be on good behavior. Our drinks were refilled constantly and they brought out extra bread when we devoured the first basket. <br><br>My veggie burger was delicious, but it fell apart so much I had to eat it with a fork. I make homemade veggie burgers, so I know that is tricky. It&#39;s the only qualm we had. My husband loved his entree and we ordered the chocolate truffle tower to go. We fought over who got the last bite of that decadent dessert!

I hate doing this. I really really do. I don&#39;t like leaving  reviews like this, But this was abysmal, I really don&#39;t know  how else to describe how bad it was besides all I can say is it&#39;s the only food I haven&#39;t finished in years. I tired so hard to finish what I started but I just couldn&#39;t.  And worst of all our waiter was the sweetest she could have been. She was great and I not complain about the service because she was amazing. She even got us bread twice! Although. The first thing that happened was the Drinks though. My fiancé and I both got a sweet tea which was terrible. It tasted dirty and old. I&#39;m guessing they hadn&#39;t made any fresh since we had be there for brunch (around 11am). But It was so bad my fiancé and myself both asked our waiter for different drink. And our super sweet waiter got them, no problem and no questions asked. Now when the food arrived it looked very visually pleasing and was hot and was out in a decent time. My fiancé got chicken and waffles I got chicken and waffle Benedict with a cinnamon roll pancake. But my lord the syrup was more water then syrup! It was wildly runny and was in no way thick. My eggs were repulsive. They were pouched horribly. And both my lady&#39;s&#39; and my own chicken was also just plain disgusting. The chicken had a terrible taste and was very spongy, not a bit of crispiness to the breading just squishy chicken. And now the waffle. It wasn&#39;t much better the outside looked burnt but  the inside was almost doughy or soggy so to say.. legitimately I couldn&#39;t finish the food. It was just truly awful. Lastly the pancake. With the rest of the food being  repulsive I was quite excited to dig into this cinnamon roll pancake. And at first bite I was hit with such a relief it seemed like I was actually about to get into some great food. But after about 3 bites and I worked my way towards the middle the icing became over baring, it was super rich. To the point my mouth had a coating like film in it where it was the only thing I could taste. All in all I&#39;m not a person to go to chain restaurants in the first place but I never had a bad experiences here until now. But I can&#39;t honestly say I would return. Today was rough. Even my coffee( which was my second drink) was burnt and was not filtered correctly, all kinds of particles floating around. I feel bad complaining this way and putting this place down the way I am but this is just unacceptable. The chef couldn&#39;t have tasted the food before it left, because it would have never gotten out of the kitchen. I want this place to be better an I hope it gets better because if it gets worse I can&#39;t imagine people returning. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this place. I feel bad saying it but I doubt I&#39;ll return either.

The menu is large. The service is hit or miss. The quality is dependent on what you order. My last visit was just very average. From beginning to end just average. The angel hair pasta with shrimp was tasty. The favorite item for my family is the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps.
This place is a joke. Was told a 15 minute wait time, that turned into over an hour. Wife and I left.

I&#39;m always left pleasantly surprised by The Cheesecake Factory. Even though it is a chain restaurant with a huge menu they execute it very well. I ordered an espresso martini and the chicken costoletta, both were very good. My 2 year old daughter was with us, when they brought out the bread she had her own little plate with sliced banana and her own bread, that was nice touch that kept her occupied and got a little something in her stomach. I was with a large party and our server Hannah was energetic and attentive. For desserts I got the Adams peanut butter cheesecake, it was delicious as always. The Cheesecake Factory has so many different offerings it will fit almost anyone&#39;s palate. Be aware that parking can be difficult since it&#39;s at the mall.

Fabulous restaurant... food is tasty and portions are huge... wide range of food selection that satisfies all tastes... service is good and somehow fast .... people should pay more attention to cleanliness of the place other than that everything is perfect

Menu is huge and everything sounds amazing. A good problem to have. Went with the spicy chicken sandwich and substituted sweet potato fries! It was delicious and hit the spot. Fun environment for a casual dinner night.

The food at Cheesecake Factory is always delicious. With a massive menu, you always have so many different options to choose from. I typically go with a burger or chicken sandwich, or the chicken poppers, all of which are delicious. Adam&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake and the Oreo cheesecake are my two favorite dessert options. <br>We ordered online and used the curbside pickup last time we ate here. We did end up waiting much longer than anticipated, partly due to the fact that they did not have one of the menu items we ordered. Had they told us this beforehand, I wouldn&#39;t have had to wait the extra 20min+. Thankfully they did compensate for the mistake<br>All in all, Cheesecake Factory is a solid choice, especially when going with a large party. Everyone will be able to find something they prefer to eat with such a diverse menu. (PS: adding more gluten free options, including cheesecakes, would be nice!)

My friends love to come here for special occasions but for myself, I think there&#39;s too many options for better food in Louisville.  That said, the menu here is so vast it&#39;s nearly impossible for anyone to complain about not being able to find something. <br><br>We were meeting for a birthday with a party of 16 (1 child). The location does not take reservations or call ahead so the Birthday girl got there at 4, telling the rest of us to get there at 5. When putting in the table request we were told to expect a 2 hr wait, and while I realize we were a large group a 2 hr wait time at 4pm seems too long...but, not my bday, not my choice.  We were seated at 2 neighboring tables at about 5:40pm<br><br>I had already viewed the menu online and knew exactly what I wanted to order, since we were split between 2 tables,  our waiter had 7 adults and 1 child.  When he finally came to get drink orders he seems early confused, like he had some sort of method of sorting us on his note pad but he couldn&#39;t figure it out.  At one point a friend at the other end of the table ordered a bar drink, he got to the person next to me and when she ordered the same he said &#34;I&#39;ve already got that&#34;.  We had to explain that she too wanted the same drink.<br><br>At some point when delivering said drinks he took appetizer orders but only from 2 ppl at the end of the table.  Rest of us didn&#39;t need any I guess. <br><br>When he came back to ask if we were ready to order we&#39;d been there for quite some time, a couple from our other table had decided to leave. Anyway, since I had known what I wanted when I got there, YES I am ready...but ge said &#34;hold on, I have a pattern to follow&#34; and whipped out the note pad.<br><br>Food finally made it out.  I got a salad and the chicken sliders appetizer as my meal. My soda was often empty but luckily the waiter from our other table was on it.  I did get a piece of cheesecake too (lemon mirg) and while the food was good I just feel like I could have had a better experience elsewhere for the  $30 + tip.

Hmmm... where to start. Went out tonight for a quick meal and introduction of my son to cheesecake. We arrived and were greeted quickly and seated. The service was prompt and adequate. <br><br>After being seated a moment a very nice waitress took our drink orders and entrees. My son (8 years old) ordered the grilled cheese, my wife, the special and myself, the grilled salmon. We chatted and talked about our day until the food arrived a few minutes later. Surprisingly quickly I might say. <br><br>Side note, for a place with so many menu choices I was personally amazed at how quickly the food arrived. Makes me think they have everything precooked just waiting in the back. That said, it was fairly tasty. <br><br>After scarfing down our food we thought about the only purpose for our visiting this establishment -- the cheesecake. As we perused the menu my son spotted what he&#39;d been looking for, Oreo Cheesecake. So we ordered a piece. Well needless to say, it came and was absolutely amazing. The boy was happy, the wife was pleased and I was satisfied. <br><br>Overall a great night... then the bill came. Why is it that the bill is always such a surprise?  A little high for my expectation at $70 but okay, I&#39;m paying for a decent meal here. Can&#39;t complain. The only thing I regret was not getting a pic of the glorious cake before we dug in.
Rude receptionist<br>I ask if I can have table right next to window, he just said &#34;no&#34;without checking the system. It is 11:00am and only few people in the Resturant.

Not a big fan of this chain restaurant. The food never comes out the exact same way as it would the previous time. Over the course of ten years I have had food poisoning twice from this restaurant l. I truly believe it is because of cross contamination, therefore I decided I don&#39;t want to eat here anymore.

I understand that we are being tested right now and we should give grace to those that are trying to provide a service. This is the last time for this restaurant. This is not the first time encountering horrible service from The Cheesecake Factory but it will be the last. Friday, Apr 17 I attempted to order from your online menu. It kept giving me an error. I called the restaurant and they quickly said well I can get in try again. I hung up and kept trying. I have used this app more times than I would like to admit so I am familiar. I called back and said it is not working can you please take my order. An hour and 3 Cheesecake Factory calls I was still left without food on my birthday! This may seem trivial to you but this is the same type of experience that I have received at carry out and the host desk before. If I dine in it is a better experience. Thankfully Panera bread and Rafferty were able to care for the two of us. Excellent service!

Many people will roll their eyes when you say Cheesecake Factory. My experience there despite the extensive weight at times have always been good. And, actually if you can swing it getting a seat at the bar will get you not only good service but fast food.<br><br>These days I am highly recommending the Cajun bites with the mashed potato and roasted corn succotash. There&#39;s enough there for at least two meals if not two meals in a lunch!<br><br>The bartenders despite being super busy are super helpful, knowledgeable, and have a great sense of humor despite the amazing volume of work that <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fthey.do&amp;s=0e8f348764bb4735a9ae4a41b69d79d4bfeb05fc0826d36a6895a29198f4df78" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">they.do</a>.<br><br>Another good way to get food from here is order it online and then pick it up at the Cheesecake counter although I have had super slow experiences there but again not their fault given the volume of people to come to their doors every day!

Their service and organization is an absolute train wreck. Placed an order on line, was given an &#34;it will be ready by&#34; time, and literally 2+ hours beyond that I was still waiting for the food. Not one offer of a discount to the food for the wait or anything of that sort. There is no food worth this kind of terrible customer experience.

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory on many different occasions and each time I&#39;m reminded why I rarely go there.  What fun is it to wait nearly an hour to eat over-priced, mediocre food with inconsistent service?  I don&#39;t blame the cooks at the Cheesecake Factory.  I think when you have a menu with over a hundred items on it - it&#39;s hard to make dishes stand out.  So everything I&#39;ve ever had on the menu has just been...okay.  I&#39;ve never ordered anything a second time if that says anything.  <br><br>At my most recent trip I had the Jamaican chicken and shrimp.  It was fine - but it was barely warm when it came to the table and the rice was hard.  However, I liked the spice on the dish and the marinated pineapple was a nice touch.  Our server - well, she just couldn&#39;t be bothered.  It took several minutes for her to approach the table and another ten minutes to get our waters.  She wasn&#39;t friendly or engaging.  She didn&#39;t smile.  She wasn&#39;t necessarily rude, but not exactly a good representative of the company.  <br><br>Alright, let&#39;s talk what is good and the only reason this place gets three stars - and it&#39;s the cheesecake.  They have a huge variety of cheesecake ranging from plain Jane, strawberry, vanilla, Oreo, red velvet cake, snickers, Godiva chocolate, and the list goes on and on.  I used to be a huge fan of the holiday cheesecake - pumpkin pecan cheesecake.  However, the last two times I&#39;ve ordered it - it tasted of bitter, old pecans.  The pecans that you let go rancid and then they had a nasty aftertaste.  Yeah, those.  But I&#39;ve had red velvet, carrot cake, vanilla bean, Godiva, and raspberry lemon with all good results.  <br><br>Bottom line - with so many wonderfully amazing restaurants in Louisville, the Cheesecake Factory just can&#39;t hang.  I suggest skipping the food because it&#39;s simply not worth it.  They have a counter where you can order cheesecake slices to go.  That&#39;s your best bet.

Pretty much every Sunday we order take out from here and it&#39;s always top notch. I&#39;m not usually a cheesecake person but I love that they have options that are a mix of regular cake as well ...the lemon raspberry is my go to and is beyond yummy. The prices here are definitely on the higher side considering this isn&#39;t fine dining, but depending on what you get it can be worth it. Plus the portions here are huge so you will have a meal for later. <br>My favorite part of the restaurant are definitely the staff. Everyone is lovely and accommodating. I personally love Shelby, who works at the take out area and is such a doll! We look forward to seeing and chatting with her whilst we wait for our cheesecakes. Overall always a good experience!
We have been waiting an hour and literally half of the tables are empty in this restaurant. Very poor customer service! Very frustrating.

Literally the best waffle I have ever eaten.  I told my husband it will be my last meal if given the option.  My husband got the monte Crisco and the French toast was amazing.  I love the breakfast here.  If you have never eaten the brunch, do so.  You won&#39;t regret it.  My kids loved their burgers as well.  And the fruit for kids places are perfect.  They are chopped up so not a choking hazard.  The waiter staff is hit or miss.  Some great, some not so great.  Food totally with any bad service... ha!

Have been to this location a handful of times. The food is pretty reliably good, but the cheesecake is the definite draw. The Buffalo blasts and fried Mac n cheese apps are solid, albeit pricey for portions. Good entrees have included: Americana burger, four cheese pasta, chicken carbonara, Cajun chicken littles. The Renee&#39;s special was just ok. Good sandwich and soup, but salad is meh. Sandwich portion was tiny for a $13 meal. <br><br>The biggest con of TCF for me are the prices. A lot of their entrees and appetizers are really overpriced. Their Cheesecake sizes (depending on flavor) can be vastly different but they all cost $8 per slice. <br><br>Most recent visit, got the chicken littles dinner which was $15.50. Got a great portion of chicken, but didn&#39;t know until my check that subbing Mac n cheese as a side brought the entree to 18.75! Seriously? Splitting the app, getting this entree and a slice of cheesecake set me back $40 for just my check. For me, TCF is a once in awhile place, not a regular go-to, and that&#39;s almost entirely because they are overpriced.

Lettuce wraps.. YUM! Good atmosphere, clean restrooms, 5/5 for overall cleanliness. However, my dad couldn&#39;t get past the manager (blue shirt) leaving the restroom without washing his hands. That&#39;s a huge red flag! Hope he had some cheesecake hand sanitizer lol

I don&#39;t know what happened to this place or if it was the day 2/23/20, but the food was average. My daughters honey truffle chicken was very oily, you could see it plainly. The server that brought it slung it on the table like, here&#39;s you food with attitude. They forgot my wasabe mashed potatoes that went with my hibachi steak, how can you forget that when you pick it up, there is a big void on the plate where it goes! So, anyway the 2 previous times we were there were great, well one in Louisville and one in Fredericksburg, MD. This time, not a great experience, and it so happened to be my daughter&#39;s b-day. So in the future we decided to do our own cooking at home for better value, safety and pleasure, I wish we did take photos. No way that chicken should have been that oily.

I really like it here. The service is always right on and I don&#39;t know of any other place that has these lettuce wraps that are so good. The laidback atmosphere and unique decor are very pleasant. And to top it off I took home a big size of turtle cheesecake. Very worth the price. I will be back.

This was my first time here after hearing about it for years. When you walk in its very beautiful and clean, date night kind of atmosphere(but kid friendly). To start we had the macncheese balls and eggroll sampler. The mac balls were the best I have eaten, for the sampler I liked two out of the four the best but all were good. I had the chicken parm&#34;pizza style&#34; and man was it delicious! My boyfriend had the cheesesteak and fries. The cheesesteak was just okay nothing out of this world but the fries were good not just boring ol fries. For last we had to take a couple slices of cheesecake home and it was the best I have ever had. Overall I am very satisfied with the food and the fast service. We only we&#39;re here for about an hour and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

Any fan of The Big Bang Theory knows The Cheesecake Factory features prominently in the series... And, things like the enormous size of the establishment&#39;s menu are sometimes discussed.  Having never been to one before, when we found one on our recent trip to Kentucky, we just HAD TO go!<br><br>It was after noon on a Saturday and the place was HOPPING.  We had a rather large party, so it was a bit of a wait for a table, but, to be honest, they told us 15 minutes, and it didn&#39;t take more than 5.  This allowed us ample time to drool over their Cheesecake display... which is dangerously extensive!  In addition, and I&#39;m not sure if all Cheesecake Factories look alike, but, the decor in this one was an entertainment in itself.  It seriously looked like it belonged in Vegas!<br><br>Once seated, they were quick to bring us our drink orders and VERY understanding after we sent them away twice so we could read through the book, and I do mean BOOK, that is their menu.  The jokes are true folks... their menu is crazy.  You can pretty much find anything you might be craving...<br><br>This too, was my first experience with ordering beverages in Kentucky, which was a 2 fold learning experience...  <br><br>#1 - They do eveything big here and drinks are no exception.  I&#39;m used to having to practically beg for a tiny glass of water everywhere I go in California, but here... they mean business.  You want water?  You get a GIANT glass!  <br><br>#2 - Sweet Tea versus Unsweet Tea.  If you order Iced Tea, there&#39;s a slight assumption you mean Sweet Tea... If you want what I call Iced Tea... you have to order Unsweet Tea.  Not a big deal, just took my brain a little bit of getting used to.  Also, I had a sip of some sweet tea and damn, do they mean it!  So, if you don&#39;t want to drink tea flavored sugar water, you might want to pass!  And, since they make Tea sweet, I don&#39;t think they get that people might want to sweeten it themselves because there never seemed to be packets of sugar or sweetener anywhere we went... I never ordered coffee, but maybe they bring you some then?<br><br>Ok, I digress.  We all ordered something different and I will say, despite service being friendly, and them refilling our ginormous drinks promptly whenever we drank 1/2 the glass, no matter what we ordered, the food took FOREVER.  We were later told that Well Done burgers take a minimum of 20 minutes to cook.  Odd.. but... ok...  Since a number of us ordered burgers, we were the hold up?  Also, true to form, everyone at the table was served, except for my husband, despite him ordering what was arguably the simplest thing at the table... We&#39;re not sure why, but this happens to him... a lot!  And, once his food DID arrive they brought it out in stages... which consequently meant he got an extra side dish...  I guess that made up for him having to watch us all eat for 5 minutes?<br><br>I ordered a Mac &amp; Cheese Burger because I&#39;d had one at a posh joint in Denver and was pretty disappointed.  I was curious if a chain like The Cheesecake Factory could improve on it, and do it cheaper... and boy, did they!  It was arguably the cheesiest burger I&#39;ve ever had.  I had subbed in a side of Sweet Potato Fries and those were excellent as well.  A friend of ours at the table had never had Sweet Potato fries and I guess the ones at Cheesecake Factory made him a believer, because he&#39;s ordering them everywhere now!<br><br>Everyone seemed to enjoy their choices and we were all stuffed... which was kind of a bummer... I wanted Cheesecake!  Then again... how could you ever choose what kind to try?!?

The second I walked in I was amazed by the atmosphere. This restaurant is beautiful and feels enchanting. We had the most amazing waiter who took the time to explain in detail a variety of dishes. Food was flavorful and cooked to perfection. The only negative comment I could make is that my daughter refused to eat her spaghetti and meat balls. We thought she was just being picky and reheated it after we got home only to realize it was actually too salty for her to eat. We ordered the 6 inch raspberry white chocolate cheesecake to go. This cheesecake is amazing! The 6 inch was more than enough for the 4 of us.

This place was amazing. I may be the only person in the world that has not visited until recently. Although choosing was relatively hard with their book menu. I have a inkling that anything I chose would have been great. Only regret not choosing a martini

I really enjoy this place but sometimes I&#39;m frightened of it, to be honest. Basically, this place is &#39;okay&#39; and in Louisville you need to put a good foot forward with so many independent places.  <br><br>First, it&#39;s super large and loud.  It&#39;s usually hard to hear the person you&#39;re eating with.  I don&#39;t get to eat with other human beings often so I want to also have a conversation with them.  The interior design is garish and distracting.  <br><br>Their food is okay - it&#39;s good but not, &#34;OMG&#34; or any conjugation of amazing.  It&#39;s what you expect and since it&#39;s uniform from sea to shining see I&#39;m pretty sure it comes out of a freezer.  <br><br>Also, their cheesecake selection is why we come here.  It&#39;s a lot of fun.  There are too many choices which is never a bad thing at dessert.  I like the cheesecakes pared with fruit but I&#39;ve never had a bad one. <br><br>I&#39;ll keep coming back because loads of people like it but I don&#39;t know that I&#39;d pick this on my own.

Good food but absolutely terrible service. Curbside to go is awful--from how long it takes them to take your call to how long it takes for orders to come out. We&#39;ve given them several chances. Go somewhere else that appreciates your business.

I have gone to the Cheesecake Factory multiple times..usually to get the cheesecake..they have so many varieties and flavors..they are delicious..the Tiramisu is sweet and tasty..the Dulce de Leche is to die for..<br>As far as the restaurant food itself..it&#39;s nothing to write home about..got the Alfredo I believe..kinda of bland and nothing I would order again..nice atmosphere to be honest!!  I love returning here..the staff is polite and helpful!!!
Unable to go to link you are asking me to go to. No place for general questions after clicking connect.  If you would like to speak directly with me give me a number with a direct line?

Host was rude. He should have left his attitude or whatever he had going on at home. Don&#39;t bring it to work. Our server was overwhelmed with tables and was not able to provide any type decent service. There were other servers just standing around instead of helping. Teamwork is the key. Only the guest suffer. I will be returning but only for carry out.

I was looking forward to my lunch today, but ended up with a subpar experience. I&#39;m in a soft cast, so wanted to do the Curbside takeout to be easy. After 10 min on hold, someone finally took my simple order of the flatbread/salad combo. I was told to come by and park in 20 min, and call back to let them know I was there. I was there in 25 min, called, and then waited in my car for another 20 min and had to call back to get someone to come outside. I&#39;m staying at the hotel basically across the street, and got back to my room to find my flatbread was ice cold and stuck to the cardboard box because it had been in there so long, and there was no silverware or napkins provided. Hard to eat the salad without that. This isn&#39;t my first experience with this location, and they always seem understaffed with inconsistent food.  For sure not worth my time or my $30.

I&#39;m not too much of a fan of big chain restaurants. I feel they&#39;ve let me down far too many times at this point. The first was Wolfgang Puck, then TGI Friday&#39;s, and now ol&#39; Cheesecake Factory. I hate writing bad reviews. I like having good food. <br><br>We started with appetizers and were considering how expensive everything is. Should be good right? For what I&#39;m paying for? Quality and tasty food? It let me down. I had a great time here because I came with fantastic company. But the grub was not up to standard. I can make a much better meal from pantry items on the fly.<br><br>We started with stuffed mushrooms, and the firecracker salmon. The stuffed mushrooms were decent. No real complaint there I suppose. A bit greasy but tasty nonetheless. Now the firecracker salmon was another story. I have to show you and let you decide. Considering what we expected versus what we received... it was a strong fail. Just by the looks of it. Greasy, disproportional portions and oh so sloppy. I thought our waitress just didn&#39;t carry it over straight, so the dish just slid to one side.<br><br>Then there was the chicken pasta da Vinci. It was just plain pasta noodles with some mushrooms and some chicken. Now this is where I swear I can do better with pantry items. One box of pasta cooked al dente. One can of campbells cream of mushroom and a half can of water. Some fresh whole mushrooms sliced up and sautéed in butter and a bit of salt... And some chicken. Any chicken. Even canned chunk chicken drained and rinsed. Cook it up and serve it. It would be more flavorful than this pasta dish at Cheesecake Factory, and less greasy. It just wasn&#39;t very flavorful. And the amount of chicken and mushrooms in my dish was pitiful.<br><br>For the price, it could&#39;ve had a garden salad or something thrown in. I feel like I ate unhealthy food, and yet it wasn&#39;t rewarding... like a dirty food truck taco would&#39;ve been a better way to go than this faux fancy place. <br><br>There are so many restaurateurs in Louisville at a similar price point. I just don&#39;t see the point in spending so much and getting so little in return. Plus, I didn&#39;t feel a whole lot of love from our waitress.<br><br>The cheesecake was good though. One star for that! I won&#39;t be back though. I want a good pasta place in Louisville... one that makes the pasta in house. If I was by myself, I might&#39;ve sent a dish back.

This is a fun chain. The place is huge and clean and the staff is pretty good. What I like more than the cheesecake is the pasta though. It all tastes so good. And the portions are huge so you can order a half size and still be full. The prices aren&#39;t bad either. A fun place to go for a nice dinner.

Overall good, the food was great as always and the menu selection is incomparable. The service was a little sluggish tonight but overall it will not deter us from dining here again! Still one of my favorite restaurants!

Went for lunch yesterday. There were 3 in our party. Andrea was our server and I couldn&#39;t rate her more highly. Attentive, answered all our questions, asked some of her own, then made recommendations. The food was spot on. Place was clean. We were very impressed. Will definitely go again and hopefully we will get the same server. Hopefully The Cheesecake Factory sees what a gem they have with Andrea as she really is fantastic and represented company well.
One of my favorite places!! Great fried Mac and cheese balls. Cheese cake to die for!!!

I&#39;ve been here once and it was around 2:30-3pm. I was surprised to find a bunch (10?) of people waiting. We were given an estimated 20 minute wait. Ironically, there were lots of open tables. I guess wait staff is limited so they make you wait. Its notable that once seated, we waited a LOT to order. When he showed up, he seemed a bit peeved. <br><br>We had appetizers (which were pretty good and better than the desserts) and desserts. Our waiter never came back to offer refills or inquire about drinks. I was planning to order a cocktail but it took him so long to come back that I decided not to and we were ready to head out. Our desserts were ok...8.50 each for them..<br><br>Moving on...

Overpriced suburban wasteland of a restaurant where the food sucks. We got here at 7 and by the time we left it was almost 11 pm! We waited 2 hours for our table, but we were a large party so that was understandable for a Saturday I guess? <br><br>My husband and I both got pasta dishes. My husband got Chicken Alfredo, the chicken was flavorless, sauce was watery and bland. I ordered Chicken Romano. The chicken was moist, but the breading peeled right off and was soggy, not much flavor there. The pasta was dry like it had been microwaved or was sitting under a heat lamp for a while. The sauce had no tomato flavor even though it was supposed to be a cream tomato sauce, the cheese/creamy flavor wasn&#39;t there either and it was way too sweet no acidity-everything about it was disappointing.                        <br>I requested the manager because of the food and she offered a complimentary piece of cheesecake. We ended up ordering extra cheesecake and wanted it all to go. We waited 30 minutes for our checks and eventually the cheesecake we bought. But I had to remind the waiter about the and finally the manager brought the complimentary cheesecake to me, which I appreciate- that said, should I have to remind them to bring a piece of cheesecake that was supposed to remedy the bad dining experience?<br><br>The cheesecake was good but not the best I&#39;ve had, so overall not worth the pain of the meal and service we had to endure.

This restaurants service is SO SLOW. took my mom, her best friend, and I amost an hour to get our appetizers/ entrees and the waiter was rude as well. He would come up to our table and mumble things to us in which we couldn&#39;t understand.

Let me start by saying this is alongside Bonefish Grill as the only restaurants that aren&#39;t corporate I will visit!!!! Everything on their menu makes me drool and has me day dreaming about their food... daily!<br><br>My personal favorites for appetizers are the avocado egg rolls, FRIED MAC &amp; CHEESE BALLS, buffalo blasts, corn cakes, crab won tons, fried zucchini, sauteed mushrooms, or the crab cakes... you really can&#39;t go wrong!!!

Refuses to take reservations for a Saturday night wedding rehearsal dinner with 25. <br><br>Cheesecake and food is always good though. Wish we could&#39;ve enjoyed it with all of our family and friends.

Worst experience ever! Ordered through Seamless/ Grubhub.<br>Inedible food, missing food including the desserts. Cheesecake Factory points fingers at driver. Seamless Grubhub say driver not responsible. <br>In the end total expensive garbage.<br>Hockey puck burgers, no fries.<br>Mayo when specifically requested no mayo on burgers. Not even ketchup and I&#39;m in hotel.<br>Run from this place!! Forget ever using Seamless/Grubhub. Incompetent morons.
Orange chicken is the word for bird, the orange zest was not ovet powering and rice cooked to perfection. Get extra sauce it&#39;s a must combine with pineapple mojito and my life is worth living.

I had a great experience at the cheesecake factory all three times I have eaten there. <br><br>Last time i was there, my server Rob did an exceptional job taking care of us. We came in an hour before close and when i come in late I always worry I&#39;m going to have a server who is ready to go home and treats us poorly but this was not the case with Rob. He was kind, thorough and did not make us feel rushed or unwanted. Our experience with Meagan was similar and we left happy that time as well. I cant remember the servers name the other time but I remember it was a good experience then also.<br><br>The booths are large and the lighting is dim but not too dim, and the place is clean and roomy. The music is not obnoxiously loud and the menus are full of delicious choices.<br>I was sad to see that they were out of a couple things i was interested in trying two of the times but its understandable with it being later in the evening and because this place makes almost everything fresh. Also, there were plenty of other options for me. Being pescatarian, I am thrilled to have more than 2 or 3 options and everything i have tried was delicious. My boyfriend who is not pescatarian loved everything he has tried besides the fried avocado as it was a bit plain. <br><br>Cheesecake factory, all in all, is a great place to try. Be ready to spend a good amount of money but get ready to have a new late night spot to frequent if you havent already tried this place!

Returned to the Cheesecake Factory because it was convenient to our main destination.<br>I&#39;m glad we did because I got the opportunity to try their White Chicken Chili. Slightly spicy, full of chunks of chicken and various bits of vegetables, this chili surrounds a mound of rice and hits the spot if you like a little spice in your life. Served with the bread and butter, I wolfed mine down.<br>Service was very friendly and helpful. And as an ending my wife and I shared a White Chocolate, Macadamia Nut, Caramel Cheesecake. I know, it was evil,,,, but good.<br>The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 was because there were too many offerings on the menu to digest in the short period of time we had.<br>We&#39;ll have to go back now and see what else they have to offer.

As someone who rarely goes to the Cheesecake Factory it was a very interesting experience when we went last time! The server was great but as we were sitting there a fight broke out in the back of the restaurant with employees. After that I was ready to leave. I will probably not come back to the Louisville location again!

First thing first, I&#39;m a serial Cheesecake fac. Connoisseur. Been to many CCF around the USA (amongst others) and can assure you that this location is by far the best, for a number of reasons. <br>Service is immaculate with a tremendous emphasis to detail. (Other locations, especially Chicago and Cincy should take note). Food is always fresh and perfectly made (they actually listen to your request) <br>Servers are immaculate and the management first class. The menu is too extensive to review, I do however recommend the Chicken Madeira and medallion steak combo, With the fried Calamari and chicken samosas. Food always tastes the same no matter what day of the week it is. <br>It&#39;s one of my fav. Chains of restaurants, at least while I reside here in Louisville. 10+

Food was good, nothing special but the menu is so vast there could be plenty of really good dishes.  Our main issue was service.  4 pm on a Monday and a near empty restraunt, 10 minute wait for a party of 2, so they can find a table for 2 people.  Ordering was quick and our apps came out fast but then we felt ignored.  My drink sat empty for 15 minutes and hers for 10. Our food arrived by a different(and rude)....waitress? Not sure. She left our grilled asparagus in the kitchen so she went to get that and dropped it off at the table while delivering another table&#39;s dessert so we still didn&#39;t get a refill. After ordering dessert we paid the check, dessert came, and when we were ready to leave we waited for our waiter to ask for boxes, only to find out 15 to 20 minutes later that he had gone home.

I love the lighter fare at the Cheesecake Factory. But even after a light and healthy meal,  i just can&#39;t resist cheesecake.  I mean, with flavors like s&#39;mores,    salted caramel, carrot cake cheesecakes, you can&#39;t go wrong.  Service was fine,  nothing negative,  but neither was it outstanding. I don&#39;t come here frequently but i will continue to eat here multiple times a year.

Prepare to spend a long time here - not necessarily because service is slow, but their expansive menu takes time to read and digest. My main issue is with so many options how do you choose? In addition, they tend to be hit or miss. The American options are really good, but the Chinese and Mexican options are sub par.<br><br>My most recent visit was with a large group of about 15. I ordered the Steak Diane and it was delicious. The steak was cooked perfectly, the sauce added a ton of flavor and the mashed potatoes were really good. In addition, I was able to sample a number of appetizers. The crab dip was not very good. It had a very fishy taste and was pretty bland tasting. No one liked it. The spinach dip had an overwhelmingly taste of spinach, which some people like. I was not a fan. The chicken blast were awesome. Probably the highlight of our lunch. Basically, they take buffalo chicken dip and then they fry it. Served with a delicious buffalo sauce and ranch. Lastly, we had the loaded/stuffed tots. Tater tots stuffed with a loaded baked potato. Also very good (especially with the spicy mayo).<br><br>Everyone&#39;s entree looked good. I can&#39;t wait to go back and try the mac and cheese burger. The fish and shrimp tacos both received praise and I would like to try these as well. As noted above, stay away from the burritos and the orange chicken dishes.<br><br>The main draw is of course dessert. I was able to sample a variety of cheesecake and they were all phenomenal. I don&#39;t remember the names, but the salted caramel was good as was the lemon raspberry. Our group also had a Reese&#39;s, some kind of chocolate turtle, and a chocolate blonde.<br><br>One server cared for our group of 15 and she did a great job balancing the group with her other tables. Our drinks were refreshed at the halfway point nearly every time. Empty dishes were promptly removed to make space for the next items<br><br>All in all, this place is great for dessert, but just OK for lunch and dinner. Prices are a little high for what you get. I would recommend for a date night or some kind of occasion.

I wish I had perfect words for this legacy restaurant. However the foods I&#39;ve ordered and requested low sodium have been off the last few times. <br><br>Maybe they just can&#39;t alter the recipes to make them taste good without loading then up with salt, salt and then more salt...  <br><br>The service was spot on with an adorable young server that my wife and I remarked to her that she is a super star and is headed places in her life (an accounting major working her way through college)<br><br>She won our heart but the food didn&#39;t. <br><br>Bottom line... don&#39;t even think about going here if you&#39;re trying to eat healthy for the new year.

Ehhhh, I&#39;ve been to a lot of Cheesecake factories and while this one isn&#39;t terrible, its not amazing either. It&#39;s literally okay... average... basic.<br><br>Since I&#39;m swearing off junk food for an entire month, I decided my last fatty meal should be cheesecake factory.<br><br>So we arrive, parking is ridiculous as St Matthews tends to be during the holidays (no stars knocked off for this). There was a 40 minute wait at cheesecake factory which is normal (again, no stars knocked off for this). They handed us one of those devices that vibrate when your table is ready (I don&#39;t know the name!) and we sat down. About 35 minutes later, we hear &#34;table of Lewis, party of 4&#34; so we go up there. <br><br>We get up there and they say &#34;ohh.... it must of been 2 parties of Lewis for 4 because someone already came up here. We gave your table to the wrong party&#34;   First of all, whats the point of those vibrating devices if they aren&#39;t being used and secondly, the devices have numbers on them. Couldn&#39;t of you just checked their number?! Anyway, my mom makes a big fuss so they sit up promptly. <br><br>So once we are seated, I ordered the mac n cheese burger and carrot cake. My burger was okay. Honestly, for it to be my last junk food meal of the year... it kinda sucked lol. The burger was so flavorless. I order burgers from cheesecake factory all the time (in other locations) and they always taste great. This burger was missing some seasoning. I feel like anything I eat at this specific cheesecake factory, its never consistent. <br><br>Would I come back? Probably... its not horrible. Would I be the one to pick this place out when there are so many better places nearby? Probably No.

Service was Horrible at best. I went to dinner with 1 other person last night. I tip for the level of service I get. I got no service but was generous and left her a tip although it took 30 minutes to pay and leave after we finished our meal. So we finished eating and waited at least 10 if not 15 minutes for her to come by. Then it took another 10 minutes to get our check. We had ordered appetizers and entrees so we just got our dessert to go. She finally brought our bill. We sat there another 10 minutes and I had cash in the car and was about to go get it just so we could leave. At this point we were ready just to leave the cheesecake as he had been so long . Now we were waiting another 15 minutes  before she collected the check. I wondered how long it would be before she brought my card back. She finally did after a few minutes. Then she said let me see if your cheesecake is ready Are you kidding me , I could have gone home and made one on the amount of time I waited. <br><br>Keep in mind they were not busy. We went in on a Monday night and there was no wait , plenty of empty tables. My goal as a server while working my way through college was to turn those tables as fast as possible and get more people in there. This was clearly not this servers goal. She was not even friendly or smiling more like ok I&#39;m here did you need anything. Servers name on check was Jordan T.<br>What was to be a simple dinner out turned into a almost 1.5 hour ordeal. We didn&#39;t get anything hard to cook. Fried shrimp for my guest (maybe they had to catch the shrimp) I got the Quesadilla and asked for no chilies. what I got was cheese in a tortilla shell. I don&#39;t even complain about that. <br>I just wanted out of here. It will be a very long time before I ever return to this location.

I was overcharged for what I think was pasta with whatever was leftover in their kitchen sink. Seriously, I could have and have made much better pasta than what they served. It was so disappointing. <br><br>The meat in my friend&#39;s shepherd&#39;s pie was undercooked and still raw in the middle. It was a late and rainy night so rather than sending our meals back to the kitchen for a do-over, we just paid and left and called in a pizza on our way home. <br><br>Oh, and the cheesecake we ordered for dessert (and took home with us) was bland and unimpressive. We won&#39;t be going back.

For a chain restaurant, this is a place I go for special occasions. The food is good, and the desserts (cheesecakes) are obviously AMAZING. The price range should probably be raised, however. The prices are a little steep for dinner (18$ for pasta?) and depending on the cheesecake slices are also high (some slices are 6$, but some are 9$. You won&#39;t know how much it is until you get your receipt, though.) <br><br>If you want to eat here for a lower price and a shorter wait, go for Saturday brunch. Not only do you get a lower price and an EVEN bigger menu (over 20 pages!?), you can get lunch portions/prices for some of their most popular dishes.

I was there a couple months ago, ordered 2 burgers and fries, we had a 3 hour window in our busy day so we decided to stop by. We wait 1 hour and 45 minutes until I asked about our food, the waitress suggested making it to go then she dropped off the food with the check, I&#39;m not one to complain but do you really think the right move is to make someone wait almost 2 hours then make them pay on a carry out. I just wanted to enjoy some burgers and cheese cake
Very nice place to eat and celebrate your birthday, very nice location and dinner was delicious, everyone was friendly and love the mango lime cheesecake, thanks you all.

Of course this place gets 5 stars. Can I give them 6? We love going here for special occasions or just for a quick lunch, it&#39;s great for either. The atmosphere is fancy but family friendly. Perfect location if you want to shop after &amp; delicious food. Our favorites are the Alfredo &amp; 4 cheese pasta.

So I know this place for my family growing up was always a big deal. I vividly remember going in and having similar feelings as when we went to Disney Land. Idk why but as a 10 year old kid that&#39;s just how it felt. <br><br>Anyways, I bought a cheesecake for a special dinner last night. I didn&#39;t dine in so I&#39;m not sure how this particular location is with their food and service.<br><br>However, the cheesecake we got was the 6 inch classic. Yes, I know we are lame but that&#39;s how it is. <br>Overall, the flavor and texture was good, but I&#39;m not sure that it is 18 dollar worthy. I bought almost the same cheesecake at Kroger on sale for 3 dollars not too long ago and thought that it was just as good as this cheesecake. <br><br>So quite honestly, I think I&#39;ll stick with Kroger for 3 bucks in the future, but I know for all of you specialty cheesecake fans, this place is probably a quick resolution to your cheesecake needs.

I&#39;m currently sitting in the restaurant. My waiter is Tom he has only spoke to us twice that was to get our drinks and that was to take our order. I&#39;ve watched him cater to the other two tables he has next to us. I&#39;ve sat here for about 15 minutes waiting just to ask for bread. My fiancé happen to get more water because he heard the sound of a empty cup that&#39;s the only way I was able to get bread. After our meal was at the table is when he asked how was everything afterwards back down to nothing service.

This will be my third time coming to this restaurant and I can say I haven&#39;t had a bad experience.   The friendly kind greasing we received from the greater. Seated us and provided was a very welcoming feeling.  Our server Mr Casey (might of spelled name wrong) however today was his first day serving. He did an awesome job!! Provided us with nothing but good service. Checked on us while waiting on our food.  The food was very tasty. My baby enjoyed his salmon and mash potatoes. My salad was as good as it looked!! The cheese cake dessert that we took home did not make it home!!

Great atmosphere,Great people! The bartender was very professional and funny and didn&#39;t miss a beat. We sat at the bar and enjoyed good food,good company and delicious mojitos. My boyfriend had a bourbon drink that he said was good. I had the spicy crispy sandwich with fries,the sandwich was a bit messy with the spicy buffalo mayo,just need it on the side next time,the fries weren&#39;t the freshest but were ok. It was really busy on a Tuesday night. My mother had the orange chicken,it was good until she found a sticker from the oranges in her food. The manager was called and everything was resolved in timely manner.The meal was free and we got a free piece of oreo dream cheesecake. Mistakes happen and we will defintely return.
I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich but it had bacon in it. Also the avocado egg rolls were sour. I have ordered dishes before  ..not sure what happened now.
We are all so extra- they handled us well  fun Xmas lunch, good times and food. I got just salad/pizza  $13 strawberries cheesecake was dro
