We had dinner tonight here after a very long day in the office and it was just ok. <br><br>I typically can take or leave the Cheesecake Factory so I don&#39;t think this review would be any different if I were in my own home town or a different location. <br><br>The service was decent. Our server was very nice and checked in is regular. The restaurant was clean and well lit, which I always have a problem with at the Cheesecake Factory because it always seems so dark in there. <br><br>I ordered the buffalo wings and the grilled salmon and they were both ok. However the mashed potatoes with my salmon was like warm and had a huge under cooked potatoes in it. The salmon lacked flavor. I had to put salt and pepper on it and the broccoli which was very hard. Obtaining he food was fresh but really not to my liking. The wings were delicious and he even brought me extra ranch dressing. <br><br>I give this Cheesecake Factory 3 stars because the food could have been better.

The evening was lovely , I beautiful young blonde girl smiles and lead us to our table. She suggested the salmon and crab cake appetizer. Toward the end of the meal she recommended we try or take home a slice of vanilla bean cheesecake!what a wonderful experience! We will be back soon to be greeted by the friendly hostess with the best suggestions !

Again I&#39;ve been a regular here for over a year. I can&#39;t believe I have not left a review.<br><br>I usually come at 10pm so my experience isn&#39;t the dinner rush! We chill at the bar with Sergio or Jill. They take great care of us as we are here once or twice a week after work.<br><br>It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory so expect a huge menu with everything you could ever want.<br><br>I actually eat off the &#39;low calorie&#39; menu. Lots of great options including GF and other health conscious choices. They even have a gluten free cheesecake option!<br><br>I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a good spot even if it is a chain ;-)
This was the best place I have ever ate at and would eat at again! It is really fancy and really nice. Me and my whole family loved this restaurant and the waiters and waitresses where so nice

Oh my lord a date night was needed and the Cheesecake Factory did not disappoint! We started with the avocado, portobello, zucchini fries app and it was SO good! Then I got the buffalo wings which were good and a big portion- but pretty spicy so mind that. My wife got the skinnylicious grilled salmon and said it was delicious- a beautiful plate too. Service was prompt and polite and dessert was amazing as usual.

I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake factory twice, the first time the food was not impressive at all but the cheesecake was delicious, and the second time the food was amazing and I didn&#39;t end up getting dessert. It is the only location I&#39;ve ever been, but I&#39;m really not crazy about going to such a lovely restaurant in the mall... just my personal preference. I sort of figure if I&#39;m paying those types of prices I would rather have the experience that goes with it, which is hard to do in a mall parking lot. The inside really is quite pretty and since they have such an interesting variety of foods on their menu of definitely be willing to try it again, especially when I&#39;m in the mood for tasty cheesecake.

Ok this will be a long review. We used to eat at this location very frequently. Lately there&#39;s always an issue with the food. Today we got the ribeye ordered medium well. We sent it back because it was cooked medium rare (more on the rare side). New steak delivered and it was even more under cooked than the first. Not to mention two people at our table got broccoli that was cold and not the least bit tender or seasoned. A manager came over and apologized for the steak but offered no resolution other than to box up a better cooked steak. Didn&#39;t address the mounds of raw broccoli left on the plates. Two stars were only for the cheesecake. Very disappointing for $30 meals.

This location is okay... it&#39;s almost funny how they are always out of what we want to order. EVEN ON A TUESDAY NIGHT. The service is great but the food is just meh. We ordered chunky avocado with a 1/4 teaspoon of tuna (TUNA tar tar) for $8 and mushy crab balls for $8 (CRISPY crab bites). The portions and names of the food are hilariously inaccurate. The drinks are great and so is the cheesecake!
Delicious food, good service. Restaurant was mostly clean except for the floor. Looks like it hadn&#39;t been swept or mopped in days. The food was delicious though.

Only been in just to get cheese cakes for certain occasions, but this time we decided to have dinner here.  Myself and my 2 college kids were out shopping and deiced we finally try them other then take out desserts. <br>The place is very posh for a Mall restaurant, the menu is GIGANTIC took us almost 20 plus minutes to read through it to decide what we like to eat. The server was nice but seemed annoyed we were taking long time to look over the menu. <br>Once we did ordered it took over 40 minutes for our meal to come out, it was really good.<br>My daughter enjoyed the catfish, son had teriyaki chicken but thought had bit to much sauce, I had a Pit Beef Sandwich which was good but some the meat was kinda tough to chew but took home to the dog (he enjoyed it)<br>We all got a slice of cheesecake to take home which all enjoyed later that night.<br>I know they are a chain but sometimes less is more, their menu is almost to big to decide what to eat. <br>Will continue to come for take out cheesecakes but not sure we will come back for meals.

Franchises aren&#39;t typically my thing, but I&#39;m slightly partial to Cheesecake Factory. The decor is grand in nature with great color, enormous columns, and nice accents. There is some seating where the tables are very close which is not ideal for conversation and you feel that you are eating with another group or family, but asking for a booth can eliminate that issue. <br><br>If your not willing to look through a book of a menu, it might not be the place for you. The menu is like 40 pages with food from American, Italian, Mexican, Chinese, to Thai and more. They also offer brunch on Sunday (maybe Saturday too) starting at 10:30am. <br><br>We&#39;ve ordered many many items over the years; Carmela&#39;s Chicken, Farafelle pasta, lemon piccata, bang bang chicken and shrimp, steak tacos made into a burrito upon request, corn fritters, wontons, nachos, Belgian waffles, pear and blue cheese flatbread, and much more. I absolutely love the pasta, an orange chicken, and flatbread. My husband has also very much enjoyed several dishes. The only &#34;knock&#34; on the food is that some  Thai and Indian dishes could have had more flavor. <br><br>Through the many experiences, I&#39;ve had a few servers that were not as top-notch as other, but very limited. The prices are a little above average the average franchise, but comparable to an Italian franchise. Of course, then there is the endless list of cheesecakes and other decadent desserts.

I had a gift card that I got from Christmas so I decided to try this place out! I ordered the shrimp platter to go along with 3 slices of cheese cake! Well the shrimp was over cooked! I paid 18.00 and should of gone to Mike Linings! The celebration cheese cake was just OK and I gave the other two away! Food was way over priced and not worth it!

We waited for around thirty minutes and were sat at a huge corner table. There was only two + one child in a high chair so it was a little odd. I&#39;m not complaining though- too much room is better than too little. The service was wonderful as usual. Everyone was nice, attentive, and inviting. The food was delicious- especially the &#34;Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake.&#34; So yummy! It&#39;s kind of pricey.. Especially for lunch, but worth the splurge.

I took a group of kids for National Cheesecake Day on July 30. On cheesecake day, the Cheesecake Factory always offers half-price pieces of cheesecake. In order to get the half-price discount, you have to dine in. I always look at this as an opportunityto take a group of kids for a real life &#34;sit down&#34; restaurant experience. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is known to be pricey and I work for a non-profit agency. Each year when I take the kids, I make sure to go during a non-peak time. I know the waiters and waitresses work hard for those really big tips off the typical really big bills. Probably lots of folks take advantage of the more affordable cheesecake deal and do what we did. Every year the servers have always been so nice and accommodating. They told us the wait would be 15 to 20 minutes, but we got our table for 7 in about 10 minutes. Long enough for the kids to catch some Pokemon in the lobby. <br><br>We had an amazing waitress. She wasn&#39;t upset that we only ordered waters to drink. When we sat down I told her we were going to get a few appetizers and then enjoy some of the cheesecake. She seemed happy to serve us. We ordered two pizzas to share. Each pizza had 8 reasonably size slices. She also was quick to refill our drinks and the bread on the table. <br><br>She checked on us several times, never making us feel rushed, just being attended to. When the cheesecake came out the kids eyes grew large and their mouths nearly dropped to the table. They&#39;d never seen pieces of cheesecake so big. Having some older kiddos with me, I asked if we could get five coffees. She was quick to bring them along with creamer. The kids, many of them having never been to a &#34;fancy restaurant&#34; before were thoroughly impressed with the real creamer.<br><br>When the check came it was just under $60 for 2 pizzas and 7 slices of cheesecake. As most people do, I slid my credit card into the book and waited for her to take it away. It wasn&#39;t until after I had paid and was calculating the tip that I noticed she didn&#39;t charge us for coffee.  I&#39;m not sure if she recognized that we were not the typical group of cheesecake factory consumers, but I thought that was really cool of her to not include that on the bill.  I super want to include her name in the review, but don&#39;t want to get her in trouble with her boss. So, I&#39;ll just say to the Cheesecake Factory: you have some really great people working for you. She was extremely patient, very kind, and truly made this group of kids first sit down fancy restaurant experience something they will remember for years to come. Plus -- the $20 you saved us on coffee can now be spent on other great experiences for my kids -- so thank you and Happy Cheesecake Day!

&#34;No wonder this place is so damn popular.&#34;  I thought to myself as I gobbled down more of the chicken cutlet.  <br><br>This chicken cutlet from the Chicken Bellagio was so good, I told hubby it is a revelation for someone with a tired, choosy foodie mouth like me.  I never order white meat chicken when dining out cuz 9 out of 10 times it is going to be dry.  Well, I finally met that other 1 out of 10 times with this dish!  At the base is a large serving of capellini pasta flavored with basil; add two of those perfectly tender, flavorful chicken cutlets; add a big slice of prosciutto; then top the whole thing with a small mound of arugula salad.  The peppery bite of the arugula and salty prosciutto perfectly complements the chicken.  One bite of this mix will make you want more and more.  And I really appreciate the care and attention that went into the making of this dish.  They even chopped up the arugula so the diner does not have to wrestle with leaves bigger than their mouths!  <br><br>We also ordered their Chicken Samosas appetizer.  It was the best version of samosas!  It&#39;s probably not authentic since the shell is made of the really thin, crispy skin, but that made it much more appetizer-appropriate.  We loved every bite of it.   <br><br>Oh, yes, hubby said his Cuban sandwich was awesome as well.  <br><br>I&#39;m not a huge fan of cheesecakes so I ordered their tiramisu (not the cheesecake version) instead.  Mehhhhh, it was not that impressive.  I don&#39;t like it when restaurants mess with perfection such as adding chocolate sauce to this tiramisu.  The ladyfingers could have been more moist; the mascarpone layer tasted more like pudding...dont think I will get it again.  But I&#39;m sure hubby liked his cheesecake, though. <br><br>Service was friendly, efficient and perfectly timed.  Our server gave us plenty of time to peruse the extensive menu.  He was always there at the right time for refills.

I suppose it&#39;s just not my thing. The decor looks like it was done by a diva, golden girl who was off her meds. I had the Baja tacos which were good yet heavy and served with beans that had been left out for a while. My fiancé had the shrimp scampi and it was just horrible. The whole garlic clove she had to navigate around were burnt and ruined the flavor. The menu was also seven pages long and in no obvious order. All in all I don&#39;t understand this place so I&#39;ll give it a neutral rating.

My friend and I went to Cheesecake Factory yesterday for my birthday lunch. We were trying to decide what to have and we asked our server about their soups. She told us about the two options so we choose the white chicken chili. We each got s bowl of soup and didn&#39;t ask about the cost. I think we both assumed it would be around $6 or 7 dollars each. The soup was good but was not what we considered to be &#34;white&#34; chicken chili. It was a red sauce with the other ingredients found in white chili. It was tasty and a large serving. <br><br>My friend was picking up the tab and I was paying the tip. She thought the bill was incorrect and asked me to guess how much a bowl of chili cost. Well, I guessed and her response shocked me when she told me how much we were charged. Each bowl was $$15.00!!  Two bowls of chili cost $30.00!! <br><br>I asked our server if the price was correct and she said yes and their prices are a little high on their soups!  High is an understatement!!  <br><br>We wouldn&#39;t pay that much even if we were at a high end steakhouse restaurant!  I just want to share my comments and hope someone else learns from my mistake for assuming the cost   I guess I&#39;ll have to ask in the future!

If you&#39;ve ever been here before nothing needs to be said. In case you have not, you owe yourself to try it out. <br><br>I have been a loyal patron and big fan of Cheesecake Factory since I first visited the then new location in Marina del Rey, CA back around 1983. It never ever disappoints. The food is outstanding,  portions are over the top huge, and the service is too notch, all at a very reasonable price. <br><br>I could literally eat here every day for an entire month, never order the same item twice, and be very satisfied. Some fan favorites are Chicken Costoletta, Orange Chicken, Buffalo Blasts, TexMex Eggrolls, Crispy Mac and Cheese Balls, Sante Fe Salad, Firecracker Salmon...the list goes on and on. <br><br>Don&#39;t forget to save room for one of the many varieties of their namesake cheesecake! Plan on taking a doggie bag home.

The food is always good. Never disappoints. However, the staff is very slow. We had to get another waiter to fill our drinks and bread! We see our waitress talking to another table for 10 minutes! When you spend over $50 for dinner you would think the waitress would know the tip meter is going down if you can&#39;t even bother to ask if we refills!

This place&#39;s food is usually excellent, but I can&#39;t say it was this time. This most recent time I went my pasta was drowning in basil, my mother&#39;s breaded shrimp was soggy, but other than that our food was great. These mishaps won&#39;t stop me from coming here again, I just hope next I come here my food will be more satisfying.

I&#39;ve been twice, but last night was the first time I actually got the cheesecake.  My daughter and I got a piece to go and three of us shared it.  It was marvelous.  The food though is just okay.  The menu is seriously about 20 pages long it is so big.  I have never seen any other restaurants with that many choices.  I couldn&#39;t decide so we just got the buffalo wings.  The smell of the sauce was so strong it burned my nose hairs, but they weren&#39;t too spicy to eat.  The blue cheese dip was great and tasted homemade.  The service was not so great.  Our waitress checked on us often in the beginning to see if we wanted to order an actual meal, but after we got our wings it was about 30 minutes before she ever checked on us again.  So, when she finally came, that&#39;s why I ordered the cheesecake to go.  We had already been there an hour and a half with just the chicken wings and one beer.
The Cheese cake factories was not what I had expected. The food was not that great.  I wait for 40  minutes just to be serve warm food. However, my waiter was awesome!

Cleavon, is the dopest server I&#39;ve ever meet hear at cheesecake! He needs a raise!  He is will to do anything to make us happy and feels bad for the bartender not making our table happy! But as i said he is an amazing server!

I will never eat at this place again. I have eaten at cheesecake factory&#39;s all over the world and have never experienced such poor customer service from a hostess, but also from the GENERAL MANAGER. VERY RUDE and unapologetic for his lack of customer service skills. And after talking with a few others who were dining they felt the same. Not to mention the silverware and plates were dirty. My fried macaroni appetizer was over cooked and dry. And floor was dirty. No one attempted to clean it the entire hour we were there...What a horrible graduation for my niece to have to see me frustrated because I hate this particular location of cheese cake factory. When ever this location removes the current General Manager named Bill Lockhart then I may consider trying this cheesecake Factory again

It&#39;s always pretty dark and noisy inside. If you get seated at a table instead of a booth be prepared to practically be sitting on top of the party next to you. Not very enjoyable. The food and service are average, but the cheesecake is pretty great!

The cheesecake was great got it to go because we actually wanted to see what it looked like. Seriously though if the lights were any lower they would be off. But the fact that you can&#39;t see the food isn&#39;t too much of a problem because it just helps make it easier to forget.
The food is pricey and just tastes okay.  There was nothing special about it and I probably will never return.

The hubs and I have started a brunch tradition on Sunday&#39;s since we&#39;re both off of work. We had a gift card to the Cheesecake Factory so this seemed the perfect time to use it. We both got mimosas which were delicious but that was pretty much the only thing that stood out. <br><br>I got a monte cristo which is a crispy French toast sandwich that has ham and cheese in it and is served with preserves. It&#39;s a super interesting sandwich and the flavors were good. It was just kind of average though, nothing spectacular. You do get a MASSIVE amount of food though. I also got potatoes which were overly salty. <br><br>I think we&#39;ll stick to trying local places.
this is a very good place peppa pig tried to steal cheesecake so i said no peppa and then she farted she said it tickled i said same

The Cheesecake Factory is extremely hyped so I had to finally give it a shot. The restaurant is very large but is still always on a huge wait. I have to say I don&#39;t know what all the fuss is about. I had the pineapple shrimp and chicken and it was not bad but wasn&#39;t amazing. The portion sizes are absolutely huge, which I guess is necessary to justify the very high prices. My wife had a fettuccine Alfredo which wasn&#39;t very good, definitely not even as good as the kind you would make at your house from the can. The kids food was good and the fries were tasty and they serve a grilled cheese very fancy like. I will say that the cheesecake is really superb. We had 3 pieces we split between our family of 5 eaters and had to take much of it home. I guess I will say that the food is mediocre except the cheesecake and the prices are high. My wife and I agreed that we have now done the Cheesecake Factory thing and probably won&#39;t go out of our way to do it again.

I love this place! It&#39;s slightly expensive but the portions and quality of the food definitely make up for it. Their menu is very large and diverse. The Oreo cheesecake the Red Velvet cheesecakes are my favorite.
had the chicken salad sandwich. It was marginal, at best. Very bland, too many chunks of fat and gristle in the meat.<br><br>The french fries were completely dead. <br><br>Service was adequate.

Came here for a nice dinner before heading home.  I was surprised to see that a Cheesecake Factory wasn&#39;t packed @6pm. That never has been our experience in Ca. No one greeted us. Matter of fact, we stood there. My whole family decided to go to bathroom. I looked around and saw the restaurant was empty. Figured I could go to the bathroom also. Worst bathroom. The toilets didn&#39;t fully flush, no toilet paper. The faucet was falling off the wall. And water all over the sink. <br><br>The saving grace to this visit was Rashonda. She was our server. She was quick, friendly &amp; efficient. We loved her. <br><br>We love the avocado egg rolls.

I walked into the Cheesecake Factory excited about the happy hour specials I heard about.  I have eaten there before and thought it was good. I walked in around 4:25pm and sat at the bar.  The bar was unattended but I decided to sit because maybe the bartender was just away for a second.  I sat there for around 5 mins.  At least two restaurant workers walked behind the bar, made their drinks and never acknowledged me.  I sat for another 2-3 mins and no one came out or acknowledged me.  I decided to leave and go to another restaurant.  In the future, there should be someone working at the bar especially during the happy hour time frame that has been marketed to us.

I stopped here for dessert so can&#39;t really give a review on food. I liked that we went at 1:30pm on a week day and there wasn&#39;t a huge line or wait time. Service was good and quick. I had a strawberry lemonade which was too sweet (and I love sweet things but this one was too much). We also ordered the anniversary cheesecake and I wasn&#39;t too impressed. Unfortunately I do not see myself going back.

So there was a 30 minute wait which wasn&#39;t bad. Our waitress was so sweet and very a good waitress. We got our drinks and food. Our meal was delicious. After paying I accidentally left my debit card and our waitress was kind enough to turn in it which made the experience that much better. It&#39;s hard to find honest people in this world anymore. Will definitely be back!

This is a very nice place. They have very big portions bigger than I expected. So had To box up half the meal so I could save room for dessert lol  Over all a very good night out for a birthday dinner
This place is always really really good and everybody who works here is awesome! This is a great place for a casual night out or for a formal family dinner!

Very slow service. There was 4 of us for a simple birthday dinner and we we there over 2 hours. In addition the food did not come out together.  My son&#39;s food had to be remade because another server took his to another table. Plus I find it strange that I have to explain how to make an Irish coffee. Really?? Probably won&#39;t return unless I&#39;m forced to. That much money I can find better choices. Oh yeah! They were out of her bed chicken so we had to find a substitute which was sub-par.

We eat here often. Tonight, we started our dinner with stuffed mushrooms and chicken samosas., I ordered the white chicken chili for my main meal. I give this restaurant four stars because I love their cheesecakes.

I was here on a Saturday evening! The place was packed and we had a 45 min wait. Being new to the area and not wanting to search for another place... we waited. As Cheesecake Factory goes this location has good food. With as busy as it was I would have expected more waiters to be on duty that evening. So the wait continued even after we were seated. With only two people in the party we expected a quick in and out bite. When the waiter finally came to take our drink order we decided to just order quick burgers right away. Bottom line, food was good, service was ok but on a busy night inadequate...

I love this place they have so much on the menu and today I got the salmon and shrimp scampi with mashed potatoes and extra sauce that&#39;s what I always get in the Firecracker salmon is so good and the dynamite shrimp always a must today was very fast service very impressive this is a place that I will always go to

Not a good experience. Harassed by flies at my table and a dirty water glass. The Shrimp and Chicken Pad Thai was not good at all. The saving grace was my Celebration Cheesecake and the waiter. I was not really happy with third place and was pretty shocked at the lack of cleanliness of my table and the before mention items.

Cheesecake Factory is usually hit or miss for me and Saturday night was a hit!  I feel they have a really big menu which allows them to do a lot of things okay but nothing great but not this trip.  Me started with the fried macaroni and cheese and it was perfect.  The macaroni and cheese was cooked perfectly and the tomato sauce was light and a nice compliment.  The wife had Parmesan herb chicken and received a huge portion...really too much to eat.  I had the carne Assad&#39;s medallions which were wonderfully flavored with a tasty corn side dish.  It came with cilantro rice which tasted like it had been sitting for some time which was a bummer.  We both ordered cheesecake to go (celebration and Godiva) which made for good breakfast yesterday.  <br><br>Our server, whose name I can&#39;t remember, was awesome.  He had several tables but was still attentive and took care of our needs.

The food is fine at this place, but that menu? Seriously? It has the equivalent of 5 full menus from different restaurants in it? Want pizza? Page 3. Pasta? Page 5. Sandwiches? Page 7. Chinese? Page 9. BBQ? Page 11. Burgers and dogs? Page 13. Breakfast and pancakes? Page 1. Fruit, vegetable, vegan? Page 15. It takes me 15 minutes to get through the menu, and by the time I&#39;m done, I have 10 things I still need to whittle down to 5, 3, and 1 before the waiter comes but DOH, there he is, can we get another 10 minutes please? One word: editing. Part that crap down to your best and most unique or well ordered items. Clean it up. I&#39;d go there 5-10 times as often. It&#39;s just too stressful.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of the few chain restaurants I eat at regularly. They consistently put out delicious and well prepared food which I appreciate. Service is usually really good but it&#39;s an extremely busy restaurant so patience is a must during peak business hours. The large portions (perfect for sharing) delicious food and beautiful decor make it worth the extra couple dollars you&#39;ll spend here. Don&#39;t pass up on the cheesecake but share its really rich and huge slices.
My husband and I went for Brunch and the food was wonderful as always. Service was great. We did feel however the drinks from the bar are a little expensive for what you get.

I don&#39;t know why I even attempt eating at these large chains anymore. The dinner entrees are just terrible. Nothing unique, nothing fresh, and just no passion in any of the food. I realize cheesecake is known for having the obnoxiously large menu with hundreds of options but maybe it&#39;s time for a rebranding and scaling down a little bit bc it&#39;s impossible to put any love into that many items. I&#39;m sorry to say even the cheesecake doesn&#39;t seem to live up to the hype either. Very commercial and marginal service on top of it. Sorry to say will not be back.

The Cheesecake Factory is typically a go-to spot for families since it has such a large menu. This comes in handy when I have so many picky eaters in my family. 3 stars for service, cleanliness and usually decent food. However, the execution of food the last two visits have been subpar. Ordered the Cajun chicken littles.. nothing Cajun about them. It came with corn and mashed potatoes. Corn had the salt the chicken lacked... the potatoes were hardly mashed.. for the amount of $ spent I would expect such a simple dish to have at least 1 part of the meal to be edible.

I&#39;ve only been here 3 times I have yet to see any reason to return. Tonight we were there to celebrate a birthday we waited 45 minutes to get our food. A family came in after us and were served before us. The food was ok service was ok. Besides the long wait the manager did adjust the bill however this will never be on my lists of places for dinner.
Alison R. is the BEST! Attentive and friendly, and knowledgeable about the products. Give this gal a raise!
Stopped by the CCF while in Louisville and my grandkids absolutely loved it!  The atmosphere is fun and the restaurant is beautiful!  The best food anywhere and who doesn&#39;t love cheesecake !!!

I hesitate to review the Cheesecake Factory because, well, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory.  Nonetheless, here we go: My boyfriend and I came here around 3:15 on a Saturday and there was a 30 minute wait.  No big deal, we just hit the bar and had a beer.  When we were seated we chose the Crab Wontons as our appetizer.  They were good but there was virtually no crab which is a pet peeve of mine!  I ordered the Factory Burger, patties with tomato and onion on a french roll.  It was decent, cooked a little more than my requested medium.  My boyfriend had the Smokehouse BBQ Burger and he enjoyed it.  The best part of the meal was the fries.  They were nice and crispy.  I&#39;m not much on dessert but my boyfriend demolished the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake.  All in all, the experience was good and I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back!

Menu over all a bit overwhelming. But there are Great small plate menu choices. We were there mid day in the middle of the week. There was no wait and service was excellent. The lemon raspberry cheesecake was amazing suggestion from waitress.

The Cheesecake Factory has never been a favorite for me but it seems that in the past year the quality of the food (not the cheesecake) and service has slipped considerably. I travel for my profession and have visited the CF in Buffalo NY, Cincinnati OH, and Louisville KY in the past 4 months. All of them had slow, and I mean SLOOOOW, service and Improperly cooked food.<br><br>If I have my way I will never step back in one again. But alas it seems that people love waiting for 30-45 min for a table to wait another 45 min for their poorly prepared dinners.<br><br>I suggest you only stop there for dessert and spend your hard earned dollars elsewhere for your meal.
Food and Service is always outstanding been eating here over 7years. My expectations are always exceeded whether I&#39;m dining in or using carry out service!

I&#39;ve been low carbing for about a month. Imagine my surprise that I was able to have a low carb meal AND cheesecake! YES, low carb cheesecake! Which was preceded by lemon &amp; herb roasted chicken, broccoli &amp; green beans. I&#39;m sure I was out of my carb limit for a usual meal. But this was an awesome treat!!

Worth the Wait!!! Expect to wait approximately an hour to be seated.<br>Once seated, we were promptly greeted by our server. She brought our drinks and ensured they remained filled.<br>Our appetizer of Buffalo Blasters didn&#39;t take long to arrive. It was delicious!!!<br>My husband ordered the Mac &amp; Cheese burger and I ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken. I couldn&#39;t even finish half of my entrée. So filling and yummy!!<br>We did have cheesecake, but it was &#34;to go&#34; as there was no way we could find room.<br>Will definitely visit this Cheesecake Factory when in Louisville again.

My first time being here and it was excellent! The setting is good for couples and groups. There is plenty of space and the booths are nice. The whole place is fancy. There is even a bar!!. The menu is great, there are literally tons of things in the menu and the prices are somewhat expensive but worth it for the range and quality of food. I give it a solid 5 and I will definitely be coming back to get cheesecake yes sir haha :)

Recently went to Cheesecake Factory in Louisville, our dinning experience was subpar. The food is the only reason that two stars are given. We decided to go around four to hopefully avoid the dinner rush. The hostess let us know it would be around 10 minutes; 30 minutes later our buzzer went off. Once seated our waiter served us and although he was very nice he seemed very scatterbrained. Our food took around 50 minutes which seems a little ridiculous for coming in around four. The service was slow in general, everything took awhile. Then to top it off we were overcharged on our bill twice. We paid and left, it wasn&#39;t worth waiting another 20 minutes for that to be fixed.

I don&#39;t like cheesecake. When the GF found this out about me, she gave me this look like I had just drowned a puppy while giggling like a school girl. But we got past that.<br><br>We came here because she wanted breakfast, I wanted decidedly NOT breakfast, and we needed to eat near Trader Joe&#39;s. It worked.<br><br>I ordered a burger, medium rare. And it actually came out medium rare. It was amazing. The fries were some of the best fries I&#39;ve ever had. The GF&#39;s breakfast was also cooked to perfection. <br><br>Service was amazing. Glasses were never empty, food came quickly, and our waitress was really nice and funny. <br><br>I really had no intention of rating it this highly, but the experience was just so good that I had to. I would still prefer to check out a local restaurant, but I did not regret my time here in the slightest. Good place to come when out at the mall.<br><br>On a side note, has anyone else noticed that those orange things look like the Eye of Sauron from LoTR? I had to take a picture...

I have been going to the Cheesecake factory in different cities since 1999 and have never had a bad experience until tonight Saturday June 30.  I had some family in town visiting Kentucky Kingdom and Churchill downs. We arrive to the restaurant around 9:45PM and shortly after being seated we begin to order our beverage and food. A few of the beverages were forgotten but we didn&#39;t sweat it because it could have been an innocent mistake.  However, after our server (Alex M) return for the 3rd or 4th time I reminded him of the water. He finally came back with the water and just threw the straws on the table, I thought it was odd, but I just ignored it.  A few minutes after that, he brought out one of the guest salads and he didn&#39;t put it in front of her, he just put it on the side of the table, which seem kind of strange. Meanwhile, we still haven&#39;t gotten any bread and have been there for a while. We finally ask for some bread because this is something that the restaurant bring out after your order has been taken. <br> <br>The food came out at a decent time and several of the other server&#39;s help place the meals on the table and they did it the right way (in front of the customer).  After eating about half of our food the server (Alex M), stop by our table and ask us if we would like him to take our plates, it seem kind of odd because we still had a lot of food on our plate. He kept coming back and he finally ask us if we need any carry out boxes.  He left and came back with a bunch of carry out boxes and plastic bags and put them on the table. My family started looking at each other and begin having conversation about the server. Everybody at the table was feeling rush. He came back again and took our plates and then ask who names will go on what check. After getting the receipts and providing our credit card, he came back and ask us if he can go ahead and cash out. At this point we just had enough and was frustrated.   When he came back to the table, I ask if I can have my credit card back because I wanted to make a change, he replied by saying the transition had been completed.  I told him I would like to speak to the manager.  Instead of talking to the manager around my family, I got up and spoke with her away from customers so other people wouldn&#39;t be affected.  She listens to me and apologize.  Overall, I&#39;m very disappointed in Alex M behavior tonight and wish management really would resolve this issue. I walk away feeling extremely frustrated.  I really hope this doesn&#39;t happen to anyone else.  I don&#39;t plan to patronize for a while.<br> <br>Thanks<br> <br>Eric

Just called to attempt to make a reservation for Mother&#39;s Day. I understand having limited reservations, or a limited time to accept reservations. However, rudeness over the phone is neither acceptable nor professional. I love the Cheesecake Factory, but this Mother&#39;s Day my family will be going somewhere else.
Used to be fantastic back in the &#39;00s.  Kinda falling off beat now, though.  If you like getting food that tastes like it came out of a can, this place is for you.

Insane wait time, then I found out they skipped over my group of 6!? Whatever...the food is worth the wait...NOT.<br>Their &#34;most popular&#34; entrée is some chicken with mostly mushrooms. Moving on to the cheesecake - just to make this review short and sweet - their portion sizes were reduced by 20% since the last time I came here 6 months prior. The apple streusel cheesecake, although delicious, was mostly just apples with a little bit of actual cheesecake.<br>I&#39;ll just call it the Toppings Factory from here on out. The price that&#39;s paid to dine here I&#39;d expect the meals to be balanced with complementing ingredients.

The only thing that keeps this place from 5 stars is the spotty service. Our male server was inattentive at first. Then he was okay for a while and then he disappeared for a while... Our party of 3 order the chicken quesadilla as an app. It was light and crispy and cheesy and excellent.. We also ordered the stuff tortillas the chicken teriyaki and the pork chop. everything was excellent.  The cheesecakes were downright sinful. Our server apparently came to the end of the shift and his replacement was more attentive in  10 minutes than he was in an hour and half

I was promted to write a review following a number of poor service experiences at this location. Sonia L. was our server this particular evening and pretty much treated my mother and I with minimal respect. She did not let us know any specials, our food took longer than 20 minutes to get to the table. When we asked if she knew the status of our order, she may as well have rolled her eyes. When she told us to have a good evening, it was mumbled and she said it after she turned to her other table. This isnt the only poor service experience Ive had at this location and I wouldnt return if the food wasnt always on point. Hostess staff is always very friendly and accommodating, I just wish the servers had the same respect.

This Thanksgiving I took a little trip with my nephew from Detroit to Louisville, KY to Nashville, TN and back. On the way back we stopped for a bite to eat at The Cheesecake Factory. My 15 yr old nephew had never eaten at The Cheesecake Factory so I thought I&#39;d let him experience the food/cheesecake.<br><br>We decided to order 4 appetizers and afterwards he ordered a slice of strawberry cheesecake. Everything was awesome from the service, decor, coffee, food and cheesecake. The Chicken Pot Stickers, Chicken Sliders and Sweet Corn Fritters make me want to drive all the way back for more!<br><br>The parking experience at this mall can be a pain so I was happy to utilize the valet parking outside of The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>The tasty little corn fritters were crispy, light, with just right amount of corn inside. Simply delicious!<br><br>Also, the plain cheesecake with strawberry&#39;s on top was out of this world delicious. Smooth, thick, perfect taste and texture!

I love the Cheesecake Factory! They have an excellent staff and great food. The fried macaroni  and cheese was good. I enjoyed the macaroni and cheese burger as well! I love their cheesecake selection. They have the best oreo cheesecake ever! This is a good place to go to celebrate a birthday and or a big event in life. I am grateful that Louisville has one in our city.

Visited the location in the mall and was told strollers weren&#39;t allowed but we had a newborn and the car seat wasn&#39;t close. Luckily the hostess figured out a solution so I could take my daughters there for their birthdays.<br>Food was good. Service was attentive.

First time EVER, and the Cheesecake was just simply AMAZING! I had the Cuban sandwich, and was only able to finish half. My boyfriend had the Parmesan crusted chicken, which was also delicious as well as a huge portion. The Reece&#39;s peanut butter Cheesecake was the best thing EVER. It is pricey, but well worth it.

I have been a vegetarian for 2 years now. I went to this Cheesecake Factory about 3 weeks ago and ordered the lasagna and 2 pieces of cheesecake. Don&#39;t get me wrong the food was amazing. Expensive but good. I did not finish all of my lasagna so they took it for me and boxed it up. The next day I reheat it and take a bite of it. I bite into a piece of chicken, now keep in mind my food did not have chicken in it the night I was eating it. So this means they gave me someone else food and not anyone from my tables food.  Not that it would of made it any better. So I bite into a piece of chicken from a strangers left overs, a complete stranger. Being a vegetarian this gross me out then I thought how I just took a bite of a strangers food that they had also ate. I call up the the cheese cake factory to let them know this happen. They were super nice about it and said they would send me a gift card. A week later I still had not received the gift card. I called back up there and the lady informed me no one sent my request into corporate for the gift card and she told me she would make sure it got sent and I would receive a $50 gift card. A week and a half later I receive a gift card for $20. This would not even cover the $56.00 bill I had there that night or even the cost of the lasagna. I will now be calling corporate. The customer service is not good and the communication from corporate to the Louisville store must not be good either. My advice for any vegan or vegetarian going to this place to ask to box up your own food.
Love the atmosphere and food here.  Fish tacos are my favorite, I even eat the beans and rice, so much flavor!

I loved everything about this place. Their food was amazing (they give you a ton of food), the workers were very friendly and everything was pretty clean. They also had a huge menu! It was so hard for me to pick just one thing to order!! 10/10 would recommend.

It was ok. Maybe if I order something different next time, I may have a different opinion.. I don&#39;t exactly remember what I ordered but it was some kind of Mexican dish..The black beans were really good though. The spinach and artichoke dip was good as well, for my first time ever eating it.

The atmosphere and food here is amazing!  The service not so much.  My wife, son and I wanted to get dinner before we finished our Christmas shopping so we decided to try the Cheesecake Factory.  Now let my be fair it was extremely busy and I don&#39;t want to paint an unclear picture.  Due to the malls parking being crazy I went in and put our name on the list and was giving a 20-30 minute wait estimate.  I thought that sounded good and then I returned to the car and we parked.  We had to park on the other side of the mall so when we finally made it back to the Cheesecake Factory I asked if our name had been called, afraid that our pager had been out of range.  They took several minutes to figure out no that it had not.  To make a long story about our wait short we waited at least an hour before I went back to the hostess and explained we&#39;d been told 20-30 minutes and now been waiting much longer than that. She said they would be seating us soon, so I waited 15 more minutes.  Then we were ready to give up.  I walked up this time ready to just return the pager and before I could finish my sentence the three hostess just kinda said put them at table number whatever.  So they walked us past not one but 5 empty tables and sat us at the last one.  Maybe 5 people got up at once I don&#39;t know but I do know those tables were clean and ready to be sat and we were leaving but they just quickly put us in one when we were ready to give up. <br>   Then the server did an ok job up until the end.  My son is 18 months so he makes a mess.  Because of this I always leave at least a 25% tip, regardless of the service because at the end of the day he causes more work for them.  I asked for the check as soon as we got our food because at this point the mall closed in a little over an hour and we still needed to shop.  I never saw the server again, no how was everything, no did you need anything else, nothing.   <br>   I would give this place one star because of how poor the service was, but I would be cheating the Cheesecake Factory because the food was very good and I forgot to mention the bar tenders were really good.  But the hostesses and at least my server was below average at best.  I get they were busy but give people realistic time frames and don&#39;t get your money and run!!!!!!!!

Ordered for two using Grubhub since I was recovering from surgery and could not get out and about.  Ordered the Teriyaki chicken and the Shepherds Pie and two cheesecakes.  The food was lukewarm and the cheesecakes were also warm.  The teriyaki chicken was not what I expected, one large piece of skin on chicken and rice, it was very very dry.  The Shepherds Pie was ordered by my mother. She reviewed it very poorly.  Due to the taste she mainly ate the potatoes.  The cheesecakes were ok.  Later in the evening we both had stomach issues.  Needless to say we will not be doing delivery again.

Cheesecake Factory is a chain.  This visit was in Louisville, KY.  I find the restaurants pretty consistent no matter where you are.  <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chain restaurants.  The cheesecake is really good.  I think their food is really good, too.  The portions are HUGE.  They&#39;re often on lists for having the most calories.  It would probably be best to share a meal, but I never have.  I always get my own.  I also always get my own cheesecake.  That&#39;s the fat person inside of me trying to get out.  <br><br>I was lucky enough to have a gift card from my parents.  <br>They had a sign that said &#34;everyone loves cheesecake.&#34;  The decor is always nice.  <br><br>I think they have the best brown bread ever.  I don&#39;t even like the white bread they serve when I compare it.  <br><br>I had the house red wine, which was good.  .  <br><br>My date had the shepherd&#39;s pie ,which he seemed to enjoy.    <br><br>I had the burger with blue cheese and bacon.  I also had a side salad instead of fries but with blue cheese dressing.  Normally, I use minimal dressing, but this one was so good, I tore it up.  <br><br>The burger was loaded with the bacon and blue cheese.  Super yum.  <br><br>Garrett had the key lime pie cheesecake.  <br><br>I had the most ratchetly delicious cheesecake.  Oreo!  The oreos were baked inside.  Super good and super fat.  <br><br>I wish we had one in Memphis.  :)
Who doesn&#39;t love the Cheesecake Factory? Delicious lemon drops and every cheesecake I&#39;ve had has been perfect. It&#39;s a little expensive, though. Huge, huge portions, but all of It so good.

My husband and I really enjoyed our very first visit here! Nice atmosphere, friendly staff and awesome food! They have a huge menu! We had an excellent waitress. Lindsey was super! She did her job well. Friendly and funny and took her time to enjoy a short conversation with us!

One of my favorite chain restaurants. I love this place. <br><br>An individual can spend $15 (probably a drink an entree only) or easily spend $60. I once heard someone complain that this place is expensive. Yes, it can be... if you let it. A 20 spot will almost always take care of business for me. Sometimes I spend a little more. Bring an extra $10 to cover a slice of cheesecake. <br><br>Good: <br><br>The Mediterranean-style (I think) interior and decor does a great job of taking me to another place (Though I am, I don&#39;t feel like I&#39;m at the mall on a busy commercial street.). <br><br>I swear I think the menu is thicker than a King James Bible. It&#39;s crazy thick with sooooo many ways to please the taste buddies. Like breakfast? Well, I do, and they have a whole page with nothing but omelets served all day. They also have some of the best fish tacos that I&#39;ve ever had. <br><br>Like booths? Well they have &#39;em. They are big and over-sized. They even have a few round table booths. (Note: regular tables make up most of the seating in this place.) <br><br>Bad: <br><br>If you do not have the luxury of eating at a booth and are seated at a regular table... be warned... they are practically on top of each other. It is tight. Once at a table, I found it impossible to not watch a guy eating lettuce wraps who was about three feet from my face. I had to make an extra effort to talk to my friends who seemed further away than the lettuce wrap guy. <br><br>It gets crowded easy. What do you expect?... it&#39;s a popular place. When there is a crowd, it is standing room only (there are only a couple of small benches. The pages they hand out when reach into the mall enough to find a few more benches... but this is still very limited even when the mall is open. <br><br>Overall... I love it. When I feel like some excellent, chain-style grub, and I know I&#39;ll be in the neighborhood (the land between the malls!), I try to work in a visit.

Being an old senior citizen, it is hard to try new things. Grandson gave my wife &amp; I a gift card for Christmas. The Louisville Mall looks like Christmas on a Saturday. Cars are backed up on the X-press way exiting onto Shelbyville Rd. Remember, 90% of the people are working, and few thousand Ford employees just got $8K  bonus.<br><br>All that might explain the 40 minute wait. No chairs of any kind for old seniors to sit and wait. F. <br>Finally seated, and a waiter is going to impress me with his ability to remember what I ordered without writing it down. That always scares me. True to form, order was wrong.<br>Another F.<br><br>Didn&#39;t bring the salad until they noticed it was missing after the main meal was served.<br>It included the wrong dressing. Had Blue Cheese, which I detest. My wife tasted it and said it was delicious.<br><br>Couple 18 inches away in a long line of bench backed seating tables offered us some beans that you sucked out of the shell. Hey, this is KY, I had never heard of them,. They were great.<br><br>Meals finally arrived, our waiter RENEE (The Mentalist) or something I could not understand, was &#34;On Break&#34; and a nice fellow was serving us. They brought the bread that was suppose to be as an appetizer with the meal.<br><br>Overall food was very good. The grilled onions on my burger were great. French Fries way above average for Louisville; but leave salt off next time. My wife enjoyed here food too and the portions were such that we took  a doggie Bag home.<br><br>Tried the &#34;famous Cheese cake. One step above Whipped Jell-O in a box. Save your money for something in the mall.<br><br>The ambience of the place in noisey and you think your at a Casino in Vegas.<br><br>I  would give the place another try on a weekday and see how it goes.<br><br>Hope we get another gift card.<br><br>Jim &amp; Betty PCIM
Great selection, so many choices. Everything here is fabulous. Great service and you must try the cheesecake.

The extensive menu and great service keep me coming back. There is always something new and exciting to try. The servers here go through heavy training so you can count on good service. You must get cheesecake here! Unfortunately you can&#39;t make a reservation so there could be a bit of a wait.

One might expect that an establishment famous for their desserts would be more receptive to diners who show up just for dessert.<br><br>Our party (four of us) popped in for dessert before heading to the movies.  We were seated right away by a pleasant hostess.<br><br>Our waitress, however, was annoyed that we were *only* having dessert.  I imagine that serving us a full dinner along with dessert might have garnered a larger tip.  <br><br>We&#39;ll never know.
Great service and food. Waitress was outstanding. This is the 2nd time I have came here the portion is well good for the size

I had an amazing dining experience tonight at The Cheesecake Factory. Remarkably it was on the 2nd of 2 days celebrating National Cheesecake Day. Our wait during dinner time was relatively short. Our server, Andrea, was fabulous! She came to the table quickly after we were seated, greeted us, and took our drink orders. Within a few minutes, she brought our drinks and a fresh basket of bread. She asked if we wanted to begin with an appetizer, and when declined, she told us about the nightly specials. She took our orders, after I asked a couple questions and asked for her recommendation between two entrees. She kept our drinks filled during our entire meal, and she interacted with us frequently. I ordered the Seared Tuna Tataki Salad and my friend ordered Spicy Cashew Chicken with extra sauce. (This is the dish that I normally order, but I decided to order off of the SkinnyLicious menu to save room for cheesecake.) Both of our entrees were delicious! My friend only ate half of her meal, and Andrea boxed it up. I ate my entire salad. The tuna was fresh, tender, and spicy, and the shallot dressing made for a great finish. After dinner, I debated on which cheesecake to order. I decided to go with the new Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Cheesecake, and my friend ordered the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. My cheesecake had Nutella on top. Mmm. The best part--all cheesecakes were half-price! We both asked for our cheesecakes to be boxed to-go, because we were only planning to eat a few bites before taking the rest home. Both of us were very pleased with our choices. Both of us would recommend our entrees and cheesecakes. Andrea&#39;s attentiveness, humor, kindness, and work ethic made our dining experience quite pleasant. Can&#39;t wait to return!

I ordered the Louisiana pasta dish and when they brought it to me, my noodles where not done. They were gummy and I had to send it back. I really didn&#39;t like the dish because the sauce was not what I was expecting for a Louisiana type dish. Also,all of out eating utensils were dirty and the waiter had an attitude about bring new silverwear. Not good for the prices.

Yes, I know it is a chain but obviously they do it right or they wouldn&#39;t have been able to become a chain. Right? Yup! Hubby and I stopped here after eating an anniversary meal at a fancy restaurant and even having desert (that wasn&#39;t very good). I loved our waiter, he sang, he danced, he was as kind as could be! Definitely ended our night on a high note! I have yet to be very disappointed with this restaurant. Oh and this time since we just came for cheesecake we sat at a high top in the bar area and it was great. Nice and relaxed.

Start with desert because life is short. Delicious cheesecakes!! The menu is oversized and you should order a refreshment before you start looking. One you select your meal be aware that the portions are &#34;american sized&#34; and sail shareable. My kid love the salads

Husband and I had lunch here and the food is great. We live an hour away so this isn&#39;t a regular treat for us. We had the tex mex egg roll and shared the everything pizza. Both were incredibly delicious. The pizza was huge, neither of us went away hungry. We did not have cheesecake there since we were going to walk around the mall. Our sever was great. The staff was very nice. We went back to purchase a cheesecake to take home. I ordered a whole cheese cake and a slice to go. It was insanely busy when we came back (4:00) the staff at the cheesecake counter were very nice. I did have to wait longer than I thought I would for the cheesecake. It was worth it though.

Tried it 4 times, never liked it and never will I&#39;ve took a Togo order that was placed 30min before pickup waited for 20min to get it. Spend 120$ for a meal for 4 with 3 salads. Nothing tasted good except the bread. Might as well go to Olive Garden, cheaper and better

While in Louisville with the swim team for a big swim meet, we went to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner. It has been a tradition for the past two years. The service has always been good and the food is delicious. This year is different. I got my usual, a hamburger on a gluten free bun with lettuce, but I got tomato, onion, pickles, and mayonnaise on it. I&#39;m pretty sure I said none of that stuff. I got it anyway. I picked off the vegetables except the lettuce and mayonnaise. Here&#39;s the thing, I don&#39;t like mayonnaise. I didn&#39;t want to be the one scraping it off of the bun with my cloth napkin, so I ate what I had. Later on, we had to wait forever to get cheesecake to go and our checks. We didn&#39;t get into our hometown until 11:30 because of how the service was just so slow. There should have been more employees working on a Saturday night, so service can be faster.

My husband and I both ate from the skinny menu and I&#39;m a first timer.  I was disappointed.  My shrimp was over cooked and pasta was dry and sticky. I ate most of my meal before the server came back by to check with us and by then I felt it was to late to say anything. I&#39;ll probably come back for a drink and dessert but we both felt similar dinners at Chili&#39;s was better!

I have pondered on what to write for this momentous anniversary, my 100th review. And I&#39;ve gone back and forth in regard to which spot I would choose to review, if I would dig from the 2-year vault or simply go with something more recent. So, I decided to basically straddle the fence and review a place I&#39;ve been twice, recently and some time ago.<br><br>However, this review will be mostly based on my latest visit.<br><br>It&#39;s rare that I get a relative in town, even rarer that I have the opportunity to join them for a moment or two when they are here. Thankfully, with my new work schedule, I was available to do both. Meeting my aunt while she was in town for a conference was a nice way to spend a part of my evening, no matter the venue, but the Cheesecake Factory made for a pleasant backdrop.<br><br>Spacious and beautifully appointed, the Cheesecake Factory is perfect for large casual groups or intimate couples. On this occasion, my aunt and I were joined by several of her co-workers. Most were from much smaller areas of Kentucky and the chance to see a little bit of the &#34;big city&#34;, and enjoy some &#34;fine dining&#34; was likely part of the draw to eat here. Personally, I prefer smaller, local restaurants but the Factory was probably better suited to accommodate the group. <br><br>Because the group was moderately large and each of us were on separate bills, it did take some time for dinner to arrive. Dinner portions are huge. You pay for the size though and I wouldn&#39;t call it gourmet. Like much of the Cheesecake Factory, the food suffers from a bit of puffery, making things appear more than average. Sadly, average is what it is. The fish tacos I had were dry and bland, the chicken pasta my aunt had was swimming in olive oil.<br><br>The thing about it is you don&#39;t come here for dinner, you truly come for dessert. Unfortunately, you may come away disappointed in that regard too. While the cheesecake is fantastically delicious, this is the one area where the portions are small for what you pay.<br><br>All in all, while the restaurant experience was somewhat lacking, I came away enjoying the moment and the time spent with my aunt. In my book, that&#39;s a win.

Food was good, not exceptional.  I had plans for a great, hearty meal but after waiting so long for service I settled on a salad and my friend had appetizers. Nothing else to say, food was ok and service was terrible.
My favorite is the &#34;Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake&#34;.<br><br>Their food is really great also!
Wow I have never been to a place that has ran out of food before. Especially a restaurant like the cheesecake factory I am very disappointed.

Had lunch here today and spent $70 between 2 people. When we got there the place was almost empty but it took an hour to get our food - bowl of chili and a hamburger. The $7 screwdrivers kept showing up promptly though. <br><br>Won&#39;t be back.

Not bad ... surprisingly!<br><br>Had dinner here on Wednesday night - and the only time I&#39;ve gone to the Cheesecake Factory where there hasn&#39;t been a 45 min wait.  <br><br>Our server was very feisty and friendly and reminded me that the Louisville charm comes in all flavors.  I ordered the hibachi steak which was prepared very well ... well seasoned, tender and a good medium rare.  <br><br>The menu is a book ... and is way too dense with information (even if you don&#39;t count the 7 pages of advertisements) ... but would appear to contain some pretty tasty entrees.  All this was made sweeter when paid with a work credit card.  I did regret not getting dessert after working in the mall store till midnight though.

The food is solid.  If you go, you&#39;ll enjoy your food.  But for the love of God, why am I waiting 90 minutes to eat AT THE MALL?<br><br>It&#39;s loud, it&#39;s overpriced, and the wait is absurd even though they have been open for ages.<br><br>This is Louisville people!  You can get the same frozen cheesecake at Liquor Barn.  Or, you could get a fresh, awesome, toe curling dessert at Sweet Surrender or Cake Flour or Homemade Ice Cream and Pie Kitchen or...

what can you say that those before have posted.  my wife and I joined our bfs for an early <br>diner.  I had the combo of  steak diane &amp; herbed salmon which was cooked as ordered and was delicious.  excellent choice!  my wife got fish &amp; chips which were just adequate.  next time she will go back the great club sandwich.<br><br>the only, and I mean  only,  issue were  the fruit flies/gnats which were a real pain.  I do not mean one or two but a whole gang who really wanted our food.   if we had not driven so far for diner I probably would have gone elsewhere.  this should not be acceptable for a restaurant of this quality.

MR says... what else? enjoy desserts first!<br><br>MRS says... food would be 3 stars but to consider desserts, hours of operations and service, we&#39;re giving this 4stars :)<br><br>we&#39;re a frequent because of cheesecake obviously and we just love it! there are times we get a slice of cheesecake while waiting for our table, we must have tried everything in the menu except the BANG BANG dish<br><br>i just had a really bad experience with that BANG BANG dish years ago in california and never tried it since<br><br>anyway what i noticed though is how the appetizers sampler dish varies from time to time. there are times we can nail the sampler by ourselves. serving should actually feed 4 people <br><br>maybe eating a slice of cheesecake while waiting for our table is a factor (wink!)

Went there for my daughters 22 birthday celebration. Great busy atmosphere and we loved the food. A little pricey, but it was good and for it being in the Mall St Mathews area  guess its justified. Been there and done that and will do it again on another special occasion!

We arrived at 6:15 were given a buzzer that didn&#39;t work.  We were told we would be seated. First one hour, then another 1/2 hour then told that my name was called when I was 12 ft away and listening. Then it took 15 min to clear a table.

I was staying  at a nearby hotel and ordered curbside pick it. Ordered at 6:50 and was told that it would be ready in 10-15 minutes. Arrived at 7:15 and called to let them know. Called again at 7:35 when no one had arrived and they placed me on hold. It&#39;s 7:42 and I was still on hold when they finally brought my food out. Such a disappointment. They didn&#39;t acknowledge the wait or attempt to apologize.  Even worse is that my food is lukewarm at best. I sincerely hope the service inside is better than the Curbside Pick Up

We stopped in for dinner on a weeknight to celebrate my boyfriend&#39;s birthday.  We were seated in a booth after a very short wait.  I ordered the four cheese pasta with chicken and he ordered the crusted chicken romano.  Both dishes were absolutely delicious.  We finished with the Godiva chocolate cheesecake.   My boyfriend is not a foodie and doensn&#39;t usually get excited about food but he loved the cheesecake (good thing since it was his birthday!).  The service however was a bit slow.  We had the ask the waitress each time we wanted our drinks refilled.  That wouldn&#39;t be a major issue if their prices were significantly lower but at almost $60 for the meal the service should have been impecible.
Great food, excellent cheesecake choices. Always have a good experience when we come here. Usually approximate 45 minute to 1 hour wait for a table.
Food quality and service were both excellent. The desserts were fabulous. I highly recommend the Mac and cheese burger.

This place is so overrated!  <br><br>In a town where there are so many great places to eat, why would anyone come here?  Why pay this much for run-of-the-mill food?  If you want to eat this type of food find a Chili&#39;s or an Applebee&#39;s and pay much less.<br><br>Now, the service was fine, the atmosphere is fine, etc.  The desserts were good - it&#39;s the Cheesecake factory, but again, I&#39;m sure you could find a much better spot for good dessert.

My daughter...being a fan of cheese cake and food chains and wants to eat here every time that we are in the area. She claims that they have the best burger that she has ever eaten. They have the largest menu that I&#39;ve ever seen and I order something different every time that I go. My last experience was &#34;pecan crusted catfish&#34;...recommended by our phenomenal waiter. Usually I&#39;m not a catfish fan because it often has a wild game taste but decided to venture out and I was glad that I did...it was excellent and not like any fish that I&#39;ve tasted.  My husband once got the medallion steak and was disappointed, he didn&#39;t finish it...probably just so that he could have more cheese cake. Speaking of which...Oreo is my favorite. My only complaints are the usually long waits and scarce parking. One time we did the valet parking and waited over 30 minutes after dinner before someone appeared at the valet stand...so I don&#39;t recommend the valet parking and would recommend to go during the week and not during the peak/busiest times.

I am always leery of a 20 page menu and a restaurant that tries to be all things to everybody. Cheesecake Factory would be the exception to this rule. I support independent places as much as possible. When I choose a chain it needs to be something special. The Cheesecake Factories have never let me down.

Even as I write this I can&#39;t believe I&#39;m giving the *Cheesecake Factory* a three star rating.  Even the name *Cheesecake Factory* sounds like a Build a Bear workshop for people with too much money but not enough experience to find a good restaurant.  But I&#39;ll be damned... the food is good.  I feel dirty.<br><br>My wife was given a $50 gift certificate as a Christmas present then my fellow yelper Troy W. said they had the best fish tacos in the city.  I said I&#39;d never go back but here I come, Cheesecake factory.<br><br>We put our name in and waited for our plastic disc to buzz while we sat at the bar.  Two pints of Sam Adams Boston Lager were ordered.  Turns out Cheesecake Factory charges $5.50 for Sam Adams.  Jesus, daddy and the spook that&#39;s a high mark up!  Disc buzzes, on to the dining round.<br><br>The dining floor is lit like a crack house.   My wife ordered the chicken thai noodles and I ordered the fish tacos.  I snapped a pick of the fish tacos but it&#39;s too dark to tell what it is.  The fish tacos are good.  Not the best I&#39;ve had but I&#39;d eat them again... if they weren&#39;t $14.99.  They can be ordered grilled or tempura style.  I went with tempura.  My only real complaint is the avocado on the tacos was almost non existent.  Other than that the breading was perfect without any greasy mouth feel or taste.  <br><br>My wife&#39;s chicken thai noodles were amazing... and they should be for what they cost.  C&#39;mon, man, this is a chain!  We&#39;re not eating at Les Halles!  The portions are huge and the food ranges from good to great.  I just can&#39;t get over the prices.  For two beers, two entrees, and two pieces of cheese cake, we spent over $70.  If prices were more reasonable I would have no problems returning.  I just don&#39;t feel like the cost to quality line up... especially for a chain... a chain at a mall.<br><br>Oh - the cheesecake that this factory cranks out... just ok.  The key lime cheesecake I got from a Publix grocery in Florida was just as good for half the price.

My husband and I celebrated my birthday here a few days ago. We had awesome service and food. We had the Spinach and Artichoke Dip which was delicious - must try! My husband had the mushroom burger which was huge and yummy. I had the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo. My only complaint is that there were 4 pieces of shrimp and like 15 pieces of chicken. For shrimp being the speciality of the dish, I had REALLY hoped for more shrimp. We had been given gift cards, so it was an enjoyable first experience.

I have been to the Cheesecake Factory before and have had great service, but I need to rant about what happened there tonight with my boyfriend... we got there and were waiting for our table and decided to look at the cheesecake selection. While standing there, a drunken customer stumbles over and starts leaning directly in front of me looking at the cakes. I moved out of the way and he proceeded to lean in front of me even further, with the back of his head inches from my face. After a few minutes of him continuing to do this, my boyfriend who is standing behind me finally says to him, &#34;Excuse you...&#34; and the man looks over at us and literally yells at the top of his lungs, &#34;GET OUT OF MY FACE!!!!&#34; My boyfriend said he was just telling him to watch out because he was about to step on me and the man keeps yelling. We ended up walking away and a worker came over to tell us she saw what happened and she was sorry and she let her manager know. The man was seated before us and nothing was said to him. We were seated and we ordered a calamari appetizer. Our entrees came out but we never got our calamari. I let our server know and she apologized but didn&#39;t seem to care. I worked at a sit down restaurant in college and if something like that happened to a customer, they would have been well taken care of and definitely not forgotten about like we were tonight,  and we probably would have given them a discount off their bill since the expected appetizer never arrived. Although the food is great, I was seriously disappointed with their service tonight.

I&#39;m traveling from Richmond, VA and stopped in this restaurant for an early dinner with some family in the area. The wait was pretty short at 4:30pm on a Saturday night. Got a table and ordered an appetizer of nachos and then our waiter disappeared on us. Finally, 21 minutes later we asked a waitress passing by if she knew where he went and she said there was a shift change, and didn&#39;t know who our server was but she could help us. Her name was Ebonie A. and she is a wonderful asset to the Cheesecake Factory.  She got our order in quickly and was attentive, professional and gracious. Awesome tasting lemon chicken couscous!  Only 4/5 stars because of the waiter disappearance.

What can you say...consistent as the sun rising??? Yes, CFs food is always good especially the cheesecake. Tonight we decided to order appetizers and were not disappointed. Plates are large so be careful about ordering a lot of food if you are not hungry. Chicken lettuce wraps were tasty and served with carrots, cucumbers, noodles, cilantro and bean spouts. They offer three sauces, a thai cilantro sauce, peanut sauce and tangy tempura sauce. All were tasty additions to the boston bibb lettuce that was used to wrap it all up. Potstickers were okay but not great. The soy sauce was a bit salty for my taste. An arugula salad with raisons, nuts and slivers of parmesan in a lemon olive oil dressing was light and delish. You cannot pass up the cheesecake so we had the tuxedo and peanut cup renditions they offer. There are so many choices it takes a while to figure which one to order. My friends from Junior&#39;s Restaurant in Brooklyn were shouting at me for eating such a deviation from good old NY cheesecake but when in Rome...<br>CF is always good and you can always expect good service and adequate food. Get here early to avoid the wait and then go see a movie at the new movie theatre!

I LOVE THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY. The food is really good and there is a lot to choose from on the menu, even a really picky person could find something they like. If you are going for dinner I would recommend calling ahead because that wait can get really long. Also, they are a little expensive, but the portion sizes make up for it.<br><br>Usually I have a great experience, but this last time our waitress, Tabitha, was terrible. She started off great, but once we got our food she completely forgot about us. Didn&#39;t come back to see if we need anything and we had to flag her down so we could get the dessert menu and our checks. I  had a lot of food left over and she put it in one of the smallest boxes they had and it was running over. Other than that all the food was great

I visited this restaurant this evening with a party of 7.  I was given a &#34;buzzer&#34; and told my wait would be 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 mins.  I left the restaurant briefly and returned to a bench just outside the restaurant and waited until I was 50 minutes into that 1 hr - 1 hr 15 mins and I went inside and stood and waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, waited, and waited some more.  They were calling names from time to time in spite of the fact that we were given a &#34;buzzer&#34;.  When we approached the hostess table we were told that our names were just called.  In fact, there is no way that this could have occurred.  We were finally seated approx. 1 hour and 45 mins later.  We promptly had water at our place settings and bread waiting on the table.  The waitress did promptly take our order and we were fed very quickly!  Unsure who was working the kitchen, but they made up time with their mad skills.  The manager came by our table and he was very nice.  He offered dessert on The Cheesecake Factory, which tremendously soothed my anger.  I had Chicken Marsala, which was perfect, as it is each and every time. NI believe we had an untrained hostess on a terribly busy night.

I&#39;m only here visiting and I decided to get lunch here. The staff is extremely courteous and the food was delicious. I just had the shrimp scampi and herb crusted salmon combo, and I order the Godiva cheesecake to go. Everything was great
Great service, wonderful happy hour, yummy food

I&#39;m a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory.  It isn&#39;t perfect, and it is most certainly overpriced...but it is a good time, and I get consistently great food.<br><br>Pros:  The menu is vast (literally something for everyone).  The food is good.  The service is friendly.  The cheesecakes are huge and great quality.  Vegetarian friendly.  Great artichokes - I can&#39;t get those anywhere else (out) consistently! <br><br>Cons:  The menu is vast (a little too much?).  The food is overpriced.  The tables are tooooo close together.  There isn&#39;t one in Lexington.<br><br>Pro Tip:  Ask for a booth, it&#39;s worth the wait.  You can eat cheap.  The grilled cheese w/ fries is incredible.  The small plates (tapas) are affordable.  The appetizers are entree sized, just add a side.  Plan to take half of what you order home w/ you for lunch the next day.  If you have a kid with you, ask for free bananas and bread to start.
You cannot beat the cheesecake at this place!  10 stars!!  My favorite pasta is the New Orleans Pasta which is spiced just right and served in a portion size that is easy to share.

Same as Cheesecake Factories everywhere. I just wish the portions were smaller. We had a group and literally everyone ordered lunch portions, and they were still ridiculously huge. <br>They took good care of our birthday group and made an appropriate fuss over the 80-yr old birthday girl.
First visit here . Food very good and hoclean and nice atmosphere. Only complaint not really crowed ,but waited way to long for food.

Well this was our second visit, most of the food was good but, some of the food was very poor . I ordered appetizers it was the wrong one so they took it back then it came the same time as my meal, I then found 2 big chunks in my potatoes and asked to speak to the manager , They brought me a new bowl of potatoes  and found another big chunk potato. At this time the manager showed up and I told him about all of this . Got my bill the only thing they took off was appetizer . I feel that my meal should have  been free . I feel like it is ran woth very poor mangament.
Great staff, great food, wonderful environment...a little pricey though. Would definitely recommend and will return!

There is something for everyone here, from super-large portions to Skinnylicious choices. The filling lettuce wraps and a skinny margarita is a choice I often make on days I&#39;m trying to eat lighter. (Hint: try to avoid glancing at the awesome cheesecakes in the dessert counter on your way to your table!). The pretty decor and sunny bar area is a nice spot on a hot summer late afternoon. Get here during happy hour for a lighter bill.  Service is inconsistent, which can be annoying, but the food tends to make up for that in most cases. And the patio is nice too!

My fiancé and I have tried a lot of filet mignon and Mac n cheese and we both agree that Cheesecake Factory is our favorite place for both. We also really enjoy the Oreo dream cheesecake. It has a really incredible oreo mousse layer.

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience or a bad meal at this location, or any other one for that matter.  The food is always great and the service is always friendly and quick, once you are seated.  Sometimes the wait is long, but it&#39;s worth it if you can wait.

The evening didn&#39;t start off well. There was a very long wait and I discovered they had some sort of glitch in their paging system. They arbitrarily placed us back on the list and advised of an additional wait of 15 to 20 minutes. Drinks and an appetizer came to the table quickly as did fresh hot bread.
